job_summary:
The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nationâs premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.

The Department of Medical Education and Biomedical Informatics provides training, research, and service in education and informatics across the breadth of health sciences and health care. Faculty interests and activities include: physician performance assessment, evidence based medicine, physician/patient communication skills, systems for clinical decision support, case based instruction, knowledge representation, retrieval and analysis, health professions diversity, public health informatics, health workforce projections, teaching and program evaluation and competencies for primary care.

The Department of Biomedical Informatics and Medical Education has an outstanding opportunity for a DATA INTEGRATION AND REPORTING ANALYST (Research Consultant) with its Medical Education and Evaluation division (MEE). This position will assist in the development and maintenance of systems to support an electronic student performance portfolio, proactive academic advising system, and learning environment monitoring system that will be the basis for reporting educational analytics to students, faculty, and administrators in the School of Medicine.

The Medical Education and Evaluation division, in conjunction with School of Medicine Academic and Learning Technologies (ALT), supports the operation of information systems for management of medical student academic progress information and related services including performance measurement, reporting, standards compliance, and data stewardship. They work with Dean of Medicine IT (DoM IT) in the development of data systems design, oversight, and development services.

The successful candidate will work with the MEE, ALT, and DoM IT to analyze, develop, deploy, and support conceptual, logical, and physical data models. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst will use business and industry knowledge to translate the performance initiatives, both tactical and strategic, into business solutions as part of a team. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst must be an exceptional communicator, both listener and presenter, and exercise his or her organizational relationship skills to deliver success.

The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as protected veterans, or status as qualified individuals with disabilities. At the University of Washington, diversity is integral to excellence. We value and honor diverse experiences and perspectives, strive to create welcoming and respectful learning environments, and promote access, opportunity and justice for all.
Responsibilities:
Develop plans for collection, data cleansing, and normalization of performance data to support management and reporting.
Develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and comprehensive documentation supporting these models.
Coordinate data models, dictionaries and other database documentation across applications.
Determine metrics/measures and/or ensure their application to support reporting and viewing needs of users.
Develop database reporting views, reports and visualizations to meet the needs of users.
Communicate, educate, and support development, architecture, and analysis staff for their understanding and use of database designs.
Represent group in efforts to share or integrate data designs with related SOM and University data systems.
Develop policies and procedures for support of new and ongoing systems to insure integrity of data.
Evaluate and recommend technology, tools, hardware and software solutions to accomplish the schoolâs data integration and reporting goals.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical associates
Understanding of the application and database development process including planning, analysis, design, coding, testing, and problem resolution
Ability to troubleshoot data issues related to deployment of relevant business solutions
Three years experiences in the field or related area
Bachelorâs degree in information or data management, information management, computer sciences, or education
Coursework in statistics covering concepts of validity, reliability, and basic inferential statistics
Skills in data modeling, database / warehouse development and management
Experienced SQL development skills
Experience with SSIS or related tools for ETL and data processing / management
Experience in the design of data visualizations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Work and thrive in a team environment, dealing with complex needs and ideas

DESIRED:
Experience in health sciences, higher education, or professional education settings strongly preferred
Advanced degree in information or data management, computer sciences or educational psychology

Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Criminal Conviction History, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select âApply to this positionâ. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your âMy Jobsâ page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:
Appointment of the successful candidate to this position may be made contingent upon a satisfactory outcome of a criminal conviction history check .

The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability , and committed to becoming climate neutral.

The University of Washington is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 / 206-543-6452 (tty) or dso@uw.edu .

jobtitle: data scientist, Business Strategy - Seattle, WA
job_summary:
Job Summary and Mission

As a data scientist on the
Starbucks CRM analytics team, you will be a founding member of a fledgling data
science practice at one of the most recognized and celebrated brands in the
world.

You will be part of a team that
incubates, develops, and deploys data products, leveraging cutting-edge
technologies that will power revenue-generating business applications and
processes at Starbucks.

You will provide mentorship and
leadership to cross-functional team of data scientists, statisticians, and
business analysts across the loyalty organization and provide technical
oversight and guidance for 3 rd party vendors who weâve employed to
help push forward our business objectives.

You are passionate about building
and deploying analytics that unlock true, measureable incremental revenue for
Starbucks â simply producing decks and reports is not enough for you!

Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.
Summary of Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
Apply data analysis, data mining and data engineering to accurately develop, automate and operationalize successful experiments
Extracts data from various databases; performs exploratory data analysis, cleanses, massages, and aggregates data
Employs scaling & automation to data preparation techniques
Determines analytics approach to solve business problems; incorporates machine learning algorithms where appropriate
Connects insights to business decision making options and next steps testing or research opportunities
Understands business initiatives and serves as primary analytic resource in discussions with business partners to define business questions
Drives creation of final insights package and recommendations; leads presentation
Directs analytic component of implementation of insights into business processes and ensures appropriate testing takes place
Develops project proposals, gains stakeholder buy-in, and ensures timelines are met
Promotes and advocates value of advanced analytics to solve business problems within department
Mentors data analysts in descriptive and predictive analytics Summary of Experience
Years within data analysis field or discipline (3 years minimum)
Basic Qualifications
Education: MS+ with concentration in quantitative discipline - Stats, Math, Comp Sci, Engineering, Econ, Quantitative Social Science or similar discipline
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities
Advanced competency and expertise in at least one Modeling & Machine Learning Techniques (regression, tree models, survival analysis, cluster analysis, forecasting, anomaly detection, association rules, etc.) with exposure and business-applicable experience in additional techniques
Advanced competency with Python
Advanced competency and expertise in at least one Data ETL (Teradata, Oracle, SQL, Pig) with exposure and business-applicable experience in additional languages
Advanced competency and expertise in at least one Analytic Languages (R, SAS, SPSS, Stata) with exposure and business-applicable experience in additional languages
Big data processing techniques, preferred
Retail, customer loyalty, and eCommerce experience, preferred
Starbucks is an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

The Data Analyst/Reporting Writer works within the Business Intelligence (BI) group and supports development activities in alignment with a corporate data strategy. The Data Analyst/Reporting Writer serves as a key technical resource in the development and delivery of data-oriented solutions to support critical business needs. This individual must be highly technical, with a good understanding of BI and data management principles, and must also be able to work with business and IT personnel to design, document and deploy the best technical solution within business timelines.
**Principal Responsibilities: **
Develops data delivery solutions using various BI solutions.
Works closely with, and takes direction from, Data Architects and ETL Engineers to build and modify data delivery solutions.
Works with peers to advance data management principles across the enterprise.
Troubleshoots issues with minimal guidance, identifies data related problems and provides scalable solutions.
Participates in the definition of application scope and objectives through research and fact finding.
Maintains productive working relationships with project sponsors and key systems users.
Supports work estimation process in support of development activities.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent.

The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.
**Preferred Qualifications: **
Experience with large enterprise-grade ( >10TB) data warehouse solutions.
Experience working with Metadata, MDM, and Data Quality tool suites.
Experience with BI tools (Cognos, Hyperion, Microsoft SSRS, etc.).
Experience with Oracle Essbase.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik, Birst, Spotfire).
Experience with large database implementations (Oracle, SQL server, IBM, etc.)
Experience working with Cloud-based database solutions.
Experience with Big Data solutions including Hadoop.
Experience working with dimensional modeling and slowly changing dimensions.
Experience with SQL scripting languages (SSIS, PL/SQL, etc.).
Experience with predictive analytics and forecasting.
**Qualifications: **
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, IT or related field or minimum of 5 years of experience in a business or technical analysis role.
Minimum of 3 years of IT experience.
Experience demonstrating data management principles.
Experience working with SQL-based query tools.
Experience working with BI reporting software.
Experience working with data visualization software.
Experience working with relational database technology.
Experience working with large database environments ( >5TB).
**Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: **
Strong understanding of traditional BI tools such as Hyperion, Cognos, MicroStrategy, Business Objects, etc.
Good working knowledge of next generation, data visualization solutions (Birst, Spotfire, Tableau, Qlik, etc.).
Understanding of core data management principles, including Data Stewardship, Data Quality, Metadata Management, Master Data Management and Data Lineage.
Eager to learn about, and become subject matter expert in, data warehousing, data management, data quality and ETL architecture.
Willing to learn alternate data-oriented technologies and leverage these tools across multiple database technologies.
Strong analytical skills and focus on bottom-line results.
Effective interpersonal communication across various levels of the organization.
Ability to interpret, evaluate and communicate detailed information in a manner that is appropriate to the audience.
Ability to conduct root cause analyses and performance tuning for complex business processes and functionality.
Ability to interact with IT and business users across the organization to resolve issues and provide solutions in a timely manner.
**EEO Statement: **
Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Clark Associates, Inc specializes in providing foodservice equipment and supplies to restaurants, hospitality, and healthcare businesses around the world. Products are sold through three channels of distribution including TheWebstaurantstore.com (Ecommerce Model), The Restaurant Stores (Cash and Carry Model), and Clark Food Service Equipment (Traditional Distribution Model). The procurement department is responsible for managing the 180,000 items available to our three distribution channels.
We are currently seeking a Data Reporting Analyst to join our growing Procurement Department, based in Lancaster, PA. The Data Analyst will provide insight and decision support to management. This position reports directly to upper management. The successful candidate must have an interest in working with a large amount of data, facts and figures and seeking an opportunity to add value to the company by analyzing a variety of data sources that lead to strategic recommendations. This position will work primarily with data involving pricing, inventory and logistics.
Job Tasks and Responsibilities:
Lead and conduct analytics projects, providing detailed analysis, both written and verbal.

Ensure data is carefully gathered
Interpret data, determine trends and come to new conclusions based on the findings
Conduct research and integrate findings into databases and reporting
Present findings and translate the data
Conduct all activities, including producing final presentations, with a high attention to detail

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics, Math, or other quantitative field
Expert or Advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Excel.
Knowledge on building databases in Microsoft Access
Self-starter with ability to manage projects independently
Ability to handle fast-paced professional office environment

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Highly organized and strong attention to detail

No industry knowledge needed we will train you. Compensation includes competitive wages, a health care plan, 401K plan and paid time off. Other job perks include standing desks, on site gym, commercial kitchen in break room and monthly theme lunches and social events. Please include a cover letter with your application.

Finance: Financial/Data Analyst

Analytics & Insights Coordinator - Jacksonville Jaguars (Jacksonville, FL)
Job Title : Analytics & Insights Coordinator
Department : Analytics
Reports To: Director of Analytics
Summary:
The Analytics & Insights Coordinator will work in the Analytics department, focusing on managing the design and development of internal reporting, dashboards, web apps, and surveys.
The Analytics team is responsible for analyzing, interpreting, presenting, and communicating data to enhance processes, decision-making, and outcomes for the Jacksonville Jaguars. This position is based in Jacksonville.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Define success metrics for internal tools and dashboards developed by the Analytics team

Establish reporting to monitor usage and engagement of tools and dashboards

Research user behavior of internal tools and recommend areas for change or further development

Design and conduct surveys to enhance customer intelligence, stadium product offerings, and internal product development

Perform ad-hoc data analyses

Build reports and dashboards to convey data and results of analyses
Job Qualifications:
Passion for creating visually-pleasing work products

Strong communication skills to allow for gathering information from multiple departments and defining project objectives

Strong attention to detail

Ability to assess problems and devise effective and creative solutions

Ability and motivation to drive a project from start to completion

Experience using SQL

Experience with R or Python

Experience using Tableau a plus

Experience with web development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Django, Ruby, PHP, etc.) a plus

OUR Values (PRIDE) â we foster a culture that promotes, and hire people that exhibit, the following values:
Passion : We are passionate about providing a unique and memorable experience for our fans, sponsors and teammates. This passion drives our desire to work hard and to provide excellent service.
Respect : We hold people accountable, expect fair play, and foster a culture of trustworthiness. We are responsive to others. We uphold the highest standards of ethics and act with integrity.
Innovation : We strive to be disruptive to traditional modes of thought, to question assumptions and to think critically and strategically. We like to challenge ourselves and to be challenged. We are known for driving profitability and creating memorable experiences in new and unexpected ways. We use cutting-edge technology and analytics to achieve our goals.
Dedication : We are dedicated to making our team and our community proud and strong. We support, trust and encourage one another. We strike a balance between collaboration and accountability. We develop business and charitable relations to help elevate Jacksonville.
Empowerment : We equip our people with opportunities and resources for growth. We want each person to become a leader in that personâs area of expertise and to be proactive at implementing solutions.
Working for the Jaguars : Ever wondered what working for the Jaguars would be like or what benefits you might expect as a member of the team? Of course, we have plans that offer customary benefits (like medical plans for eligible employees), but we also offer way more than the basics. We take P.R.I.D.E. in our employees and want you to be your best. We offer:

Learning Opportunities

Through Jaguars University courses, you will receive the tools to succeed in business, such as training in budgeting, leadership and writing skills.

Eligible employees have the opportunity for tuition reimbursement
A Wellness Program , which includes:
Onsite gym

Onsite fitness classes

Discounted health club membership

Free lunch with input from a registered dietician

4 employer-sponsored sports leagues

Weekly wellness tips

Fitness challenges

Fit Friendly Worksite Platinum Achievement (AHA)

We recognize and reward you

We value your hard work and dedication and recognize outstanding work and actions through our Teammate, Manager and Director of the Quarter Programs.

Our Pride In Innovation Award recognizes the collaborative efforts of departments

We hold teambuilding events to help you get to know your co-workers

We value diversity and communication

Our Jaguars Women in Business program is designed to give women the tools they need to lead and to succeed in business

Through our mentoring program, you have the opportunity to learn from one another

We care about you and your family

Employees have access to an Employee Assistance Program, the NFL Lifeline and our âsafe ridesâ program

We offer scholarship opportunities for your children

Our employees receive discounts from many of our vendors

We offer discounted tickets to our employees, and, if available, will provide tickets to our home games!
Applications are being accepted online only. Please do not call to apply for this position. Please provide complete information. An incomplete application may affect your consideration for this position. The Jacksonville Jaguars are committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, rules, or legal requirements.
By submitting this application, you understand that you may be subject to a pre-employment drug test. You certify that the information in your application is true, correct and complete. You authorize the Jaguars and its representatives to contact your prior employers and other references and all others for purposes of certification of the information you have provided. You understand your application is subject to, among other things, your eligibility to work in the United States.

jobtitle: Statistical Analyst - Data Analytics and Reporting
job_summary:
-

029264

For more than a century, Mutual of Omaha has been committed to helping our customers through life's transitions by providing an array of insurance, financial and banking products.

Known for its strength and stability, our company is made up of quality, engaged individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life.

We have made it a priority to

create a culture where everyone feels included, valued and empowered. We encourage new ideas, try new things, and always learn from experience as we seek the optimum solutions. We relentlessly pursue ways to simplify and streamline our operations. Through innovation, design and experimentation we continually find ways to grow the business and enhance the customer experience. Release your potential and begin a rewarding career with us.
Essential Job Functions:
Develops comprehensive understanding and knowledge base of those business processes related to the marketing database, audience selection, and creative testing and how they impact models used by DTC.

Ensures standards and consistency of model development processes are met, including compliance with Model Risk Management standards.

Applies statistical, mathematical, and business skills to proactively identify opportune areas for adding business value.

Monitors, evaluates, and communicates performance of models developed internally.

Provides expertise on the impact of data changes made by vendors on model performance including whether recalibration or re-building of existing models is required.

Acts as the business steward over the lead attribution database; including, providing ongoing data quality improvements.

Stays connected with progress of projects that impact required attribution keys within the lead attribution database. Demonstrates leadership behaviors with the Company's standards. Develops and maintains a fair and equitable work environment.

Excellence customer service and presentation skills

This job posting is reflective of the Database Marketing Program Manager essential functions, qualifications, and physical requirements. The Senior Database Marketing Program Manager level has variable essential functions, qualifications and physical requirements. Competency and skill set will determine level of placement within the posted job family.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelorâs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science

Fluency in relational databases and excellent knowledge of SQL and/or advanced skills using statistical software â SAS

Excellent knowledge of Excel and Tableau

Ability to self-motivate, work well within a team environment, and be results driven

Understanding of database marketing principles

Solid financial and analytical discipline

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Ability to think strategically, makes sound business decisions, and has good problem solving skills

Ability to manage multiple projects, deadlines, and priorities

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics or Statistics

Expert knowledge of SQL language

Expert knowledge of SAS code

To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at 1-800-780-0304. We are available Monday through Friday 7 am to 4 pm CST.

For all other inquiries, contact our HR Helpline at 1-800-365-1405, option 4.

Requisition #: 171621
Title: Data Analyst, Performance, Analysis and Reporting
Department: Performance Reporting
Posting Date: January 12, 2017
Status: Exempt
Hours: 40 hrs. M-F 8:30-5:00
Location: UMass Memorial Medical Center â 1 Mercantile Street, Worcester, MA
UMass Memorial Medical Center is the region's trusted academic medical center, and part of the UMass Memorial Health Care system. We are committed to improving the health of people in Central Massachusetts through excellence in care, comprehensive health services, teaching and research.
Position Summary:

Under the direction of the Manager of Reporting and Analysis, the Data Analyst, Performance Analysis and Reporting will develop and deploy data analyses, reports and quality improvement projects on behalf of the Managed Care Network and the Accountable Care Organization.
Position Qualifications:

Bachelors level degree and minimum of 2 years experience in complex data analyses. Experience with Microsoft Access and Excel required. Experience with SPSS preferred. Demonstrated ability to plan, organize, and execute complex projects. Experience in health care quality improvement initiatives. Ability to collaborate with IT professionals in development of decision support tools. Position requires a high level of attention to detail, excellent analytic and organizational skills. Incumbent will have frequent written and verbal communication with clinical, educational, and managed care audiences, and work closely with internal and external information technology professionals.
Major Responsibilities:

Conducts or assists in routine or ad-hoc reporting and data analyses as assigned for the delivery of accurate, timely and actionable information to physicians and administrators to support the improvement of care delivery within the UMass Memorial system.

Ensures accuracy of reports and analyses by testing data reliability and validity.

Produces thorough documentation, consistent with department standards, of all reports and analyses.

Works closely with internal IT staff and external IT vendors in development of decision support/reminder and performance reporting system.

Maintains timelines and ensures success of improvement project deliverables as assigned by Medical Management.

Effectively communicates with key stakeholder communities using multiple channels: verbal, written, and electronic.

Ensures teamwork, communication and mission focus in the management of assigned areas.

Participates in performance improvement initiatives and demonstrates the use of quality improvement in daily operations.

Ensures compliance with the ACO and Managed Care Network policies and regulatory agencies such as Joint Commission, DPH, etc. Develops and maintains procedures necessary to meet regulatory requirements.

Ensures that department complies with hospital established policies, quality assurance programs, safety, and infection control policies and procedures.

Develops and maintains established departmental policies, procedures, and objectives.

Ensures compliance to all health and safety regulations and requirements.

Respects diverse views and approaches, and contributes in maintaining an environment of professionalism, tolerance, civility and acceptance toward all employees, patients and visitors.

Performs similar or related duties as required or directed.
All responsibilities are essential job functions.

SUMMARY
Responsible for the solicitation, tracking, validation and analysis of supplemental rebate offers. The position maintains responsibility for the facilitation of P&T cycles including, managing timelines, building complex cost models for state Medicaid clients and P&T committee members, and reviewing offers with Account Managers. Additionally responsible for running quarterly PDL reports and Adhoc requests for internal and external customers using a variety of data gathering tools such as Hyperion or Cognos.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
-Work with designated department to assess, define, and develop report deliverables to meet internal and customer requirements. Design appropriate data repository and reporting tools that will be used to organize, analyze, and report data. Query data bases to extract information needed to develop reports. Compile data and other information from multiple data sources.
-Support the development of standard reports.
-Interpret, analyze and provide recommendations regarding data accuracy and data collection needs and processes. Work with business unit(s) to identify opportunities to enhance existing and to develop new data information processes and tools. Continuously assess and improve data collection and reporting processes.
-Coordinate or independently complete special projects. Assist staff members with more complex and detailed projects including root cause analyses, trended reporting and analyses which support continuous quality improvement leading to actionable information.
-Participate and support staff training related to data collection and reporting.
-Other duties as assigned.
General Job Information
Title Data and Reporting Analyst-Magellan MRx - Blue Ash, OH
Job Family Metrics_Analysis_GS
Country United States of America
FLSA Status United States of America (Exempt)
Recruiting Start Date 1/3/2017
Date Requisition Created 1/3/2017
Minimum Qualifications
Education Associates, BachelorsAssociates (Required), Bachelors
License and Certifications
Other Job Requirements
Responsibilities Requires an Associates Degree in information systems, business administration, or analytics. Requires strong expertise in MS Excel and relational database such as MS Access and other database management (MS SQL) and reporting tools. Ability to use reporting software such as Actuate, Cognos, Crystal reports, SAS, or other. Ability to query the company's data warehouse and/or department systems in response to data requests.
Competencies
Language(s)
Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

University Hospitals (UH) is a community-based healthcare system which serves patients at more than 150 locations throughout Northern Ohio, including seven wholly owned and four affiliated hospitals.

Committed to advanced care and advanced caring, UH encompasses the regions largest network of primary care physicians, outpatient centers and hospitals. The network also offers specialty care physicians to treat almost every disease and condition, skilled nursing, elder health, rehabilitation and home care services, and occupational health and wellness. University Hospitals is the second largest private sector employer in Northeast Ohio and is within the top five largest private sector employers in the state of Ohio.

The Junior Data Scientist is responsible for using statistical inference and data mining techniques to understand data and create powerful predictive models, and also be able to communicate complex analyses in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to management and executive level audiences.
Responsibilities
Working directly with client stakeholders to understand and define analysis objectives and then translate these into actionable results. Obtaining data from multiple, disparate data sources including structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Using mathematical and data mining techniques to understand the patterns in large volumes of data, identify relationships and data clusters, detect data anomalies, and classify data sets. Working with data integration developers to assess data quality and define data processing business rules for cleansing, aggregation, enhancement etc. support analysis and predictive modelling activities. Designing and building algorithms to enable predictive models using linear and logistic regression or support vector machines. Presenting complex analysis results tailored to different audiences (e.g. technical, manager, executive) in a highly consumable and actionable form including the use of data visualizations.
Qualifications
Technical:
1+ years in a hands on role performing advanced predictive analytics using tools like Python, R, or SAS. 1+ years writing simple to complex SQL queries to obtain data from multiple source systems. 1+ years using data mining methods, such as clustering and anomaly detection, to understand data patterns and select appropriate predictive techniques. Proficient understanding of relational (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) database structures in order to source data effectively. Experience using advanced analytics techniques for fraud detection and prevention preferred. Experience working with social media data sources (e.g. Twitter, Facebook) preferred.
Non-Technical:
A degree in Applied Math, Statistics, Econometrics, Information Science, Computer Science, or related field Excellent communication skills to be able to interact directly with non-technical client stakeholders and act in a business-to-technical translation role. Experience working in an onsite client technical consulting environment preferred.

This position will be part of the Process Governance and Reporting (PGR) team within Marketing Services (MKS). Marketing Services executes marketing campaigns as part of the Consumer and Community Bank (CCB) Shared Services group. Overview:
Under general supervision, the Data Scientist works in the fields of population health, risk stratification, patient segmentation, and geospatial analysis. The Data Scientist is responsible for developing mathematical models, working prototypes, and visualizations. The role requires strong communication skills and the ability to constructively challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members. The primary function of this role is to engage with stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence clinical and operational decisions.
Schedule: Exempt 40 hours per week (1.0 FTE)
Essential Functions:
Descriptive statistical analysis, predictive modeling, supervised and unsupervised machine learning, feature engineering, geospatial analysis, data mining and cleansing. Transform complex datasets into pragmatic and actionable insights.

Maintain current analytics solutions.

Research new data sources, technologies, platforms, and techniques.

Assist with business intelligence delivery, troubleshooting data and information issues.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Bachelor of Science degree with five or more years of professional experience in Data Science roles; or Master of Science degree with two or more years of professional experience in Data Science roles.

Minimum of two to five yearsâ experience in applied data science environment in healthcare or commercial field working on time-critical projects with multiple customer stakeholders and teammates.

Knowledge of computational statistics, preferred.

Knowledge of statistical programming and visualization techniques.

Experience solving real world problems using data mining techniques and applied statistical rigor.

Demonstrated proficiency with R (required) and SQL (preferred).

Strong analytical skills and the demonstrated ability to perform design and analysis of a project based on a given specification.

Ability to work independently, establish priorities and organize work to meet demands.

Ability to work well with other teammates, networking personnel, computer operators and clinical personnel.

Ability to think logically and communicate clearly both in writing and verbally.

Must be able to handle multiple tasks at one time.

Ability to function and contribute as a team player.

DaVita Medical Group manages and operates medical groups and affiliated physician networks in California, Nevada, New Mexico, Florida, Colorado and Washington in its pursuit to deliver excellent-quality health care in a dignified and compassionate manner. Students serving as Data Scientist interns work side-by-side with other data scientists using advanced hardware and software to create and develop computational algorithms and statistical methods that find patterns and relationships in large volumes of data.

Through CIA's global mission, the agency has access to unique data sets that can be analyzed in one computational environment. Successful applicants will have keen technical insight, creativity, initiative, and a curious mind.

Interns generally are required to work either a combination of one semester and one summer internship or two 90-day summer internships. Co-Op Students work on an alternating semester or quarterly basis and are expected to spend a minimum of three semesters or four quarters (this can include a summer tour) on the job prior to graduation.

Offices of the CIA - Directorate of Digital Innovation

The Directorate of Digital Innovation (DDI) is at the forefront of defining the future of digital expertise within the CIA. DDI focuses on developing the workforce with cutting-edge skills, investing in IT infrastructure, and modernizing the way the Agency does business. DDI officers help accelerate the integration of innovative methods and tools to enhance the CIA's cyber and digital capabilities on a global scale and ultimately help safeguard our nation. Learn more about the Directorate of Digital Innovation
Life at CIA:
In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, the CIA offers exciting career opportunities and a dynamic environment. We're on the forefront of world-altering events - as they happen. So working here isn't just a job, it's a mindset and a lifestyle.
Minimum Qualifications:
Pursuing Bachelor's degree in any area

GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale

Leadership abilities, initiative, creativity, integrity, technical excellence, and strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)

Ability to work independently and in a group

Experience with advanced statistical or computational programming and modern databases and distributed computing systems

Availability to work two 90-day tours prior to graduation

Attending school on a full-time basis before/following this internship
Desired Qualifications:
Interest or experience in data analytics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, operations research, computational social science, quantitative finance, engineering or other data analysis fields

The following items must be attached to your on-line application (PDF format preferred):

Your resume.

A cover letter in which you specify your qualifications for one or more positions.

Unofficial transcripts for all degrees.

ALL POSITIONS REQUIRE RELOCATION TO THE WASHINGTON DC METROPOLITAN AREA.

All applicants must successfully complete a thorough medical and psychological exam, a polygraph interview, and an extensive background investigation. US citizenship is required.

To be considered suitable for Agency employment, applicants must generally not have used illegal drugs within the last twelve months. The issue of illegal drug use prior to twelve months ago is carefully evaluated during the medical and security processing.
Important Notice: Friends, family, individuals, or organizations may be interested to learn that you are an applicant for or an employee of the CIA. Their interest, however, may not be benign or in your best interest. You cannot control whom they would tell. We therefore ask you to exercise discretion and good judgment in disclosing your interest in a position with the Agency. You will receive further guidance on this topic as you proceed through your CIA employment processing.

Job cart selections will only be retained during this site visit, so be sure to click âApply Nowâ before closing the browser window. After clicking "Apply Now" you will be taken to the application account creation page. The positions will appear in the cart once you have created an account. DO NOT submit multiple applications; this will only slow the review of your application and delay processing. Please read the Application Instructions carefully before you begin the online application process.

jobtitle: Lead Health Data Analyst, Clinical Program Reporting
job_summary:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of Californiaâs Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Collects, analyzes and synthesizes data; develops information to guide business decision making for BSC populations' health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies. Responsibilities: Mastery of Associate, Intermediate and Senior level responsibilities. Independently writes reports and presents data in formats such as abstracts, graphs or summaries. Develops technical specs and develops and executes work plans that may involve collaboration with more than one team.

Coordinates the design of reports that integrate data from multiple sources, including design of reporting systems and standardization of metrics and formats across departments and functional areas. Designs, builds and enhances database systems and applications for complex, high level reporting requirements. Critically reviews and revises existing systems and applications for update and enhancement. Identifies systems and operational problems and recommends solutions and changes to streamline procedures for more effective reporting. Manages complex business reporting system design and implementation, including systems for QA and report documentation.

Functions as facilitator and/or mentor for data reporting projects, teams and task forces. Provides training and mentoring for team members on best practices for analysis and reporting; assists in the development of supplemental analytic training tools and materials. Supplies consultative advice to analysts in other departments and business units regarding standard business rules and algorithms.

Provides coordination and oversight of peer review of accuracy, completeness and report/system design and implementation. Assesses business risks relating to back up for reporting design and production and develops and implements plans to mitigate risks. Coordinates interaction between data analysis teams and support functions including information systems, provider relations and medical management. Collaboration/leadership role in the critical review and ongoing development of data management and systems for strategically important enterprise-wide reporting. Ad hoc assignments as requested

Qualifications
Education/Requirements: Requires an MPH, MBA, MS, MA in science, social science, public health, health services research or business, or BA/BS with demonstrated equivalent work experience. PhD preferred.

Position also requires five to 10 years experience in Health Care (managed care, academic, or gov't payer), demonstrated ability to work with all clinical coding systems (e.g., ICD9, CPT, DRG, LOINC, RxHUB). MS Office, esp. Excel and Access, Unix, SQL/PL-SQL,SAS.

Must be able to develop new SAS programs and SQL scripts that improve the efficiency of the work of others. SAS Base and Adv. Certification preferred Minimum Experience Level: Typically has 5 or more years experience as a Health Data Analyst, Medical Economist or related role in a managed care setting.

Monday-Friday 8:30am-5:30pm

McLeod Office

4221 McLeod Dr.

Las Vegas, NV 89121
SUMMARY:
The Data Analyst will provide critical data reporting delivery, packaging, and analytic capabilities. This role will analyze complex data structures to generate useful business insights and develop reporting to monitor business critical results. The Data Analyst will support the leadership team with data consultation, data gathering, data delivery, and data analysis.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES may include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Investigate data issues in account data from acquisition through presentation in the UI.

Assist in identifying issues that may adversely affect the performance of the Information

Technology department.

Perform unscheduled ad-hoc analysis for business partners and the credit union team.

Answer and document 'help desk' phone calls from credit union employees.

Participate on project teams.

Communicate with business partners to establish data requirements.

Be the official Information Technology representative in a variety of credit union endeavors.

Present final analysis to business partners and/or the credit union team.

Consult within and outside of Information Technology, professionally, to enlighten and educate.

Create tools or queries to obtain data from central data repository for the purposes of reporting and analysis.

Empower every user with data so they can make sound decision.

Perform ad-hoc analysis for business partners and the credit union team.

Implement analytic directives on data from senior staff and clients and develop written reports as needed.

Run SQL queries to produce counts, statistics, reports and graphs to circulate quantitative information to all departments.

Analyzing data sets and presenting results in an easily readable format.

Interpret available data to identify significant trends in operational statistics and prepare conclusions and forecasts based on those trends.

Use a variety of database software techniques to produce various media tools such as: reports, charts, graphs, lists, labels, memos, etc

Recommend and/or identify key business metrics.

Create or update reporting presentations and other documentation.

Assist in designing, documenting, programming and standardizing processes and reports.

Participate in quality assurance of measures including test case creation, SQL code review, independent results validation, and pulling sample cases from member data to support User Acceptance Testing.

Audit processes to ensure adherence to defined policies, processes, and procedures; generate formal report of audit findings.

Create or update documentation including policies, data flows, methods and procedures and other documentation as required.

Manipulating large data files using SQL, MS Query and MS Excel including pivoting capabilities and creating macros.

Ability to handle large data sets while maintaining database integrity.

Creating and scheduling targeted reports, data collection jobs, integration(s), and secure transfers of data.

May code new or modified programs, reuse existing code through the use of program development software alternatives and/or integrate purchased solutions.

Document, test, implement and provide on-going support for the application(s).

Assure validity by checking data accuracy, applying reasonability checks, and maintaining audit trails.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
BS in Computer Science or comparable accredited program with a quantitative emphasis or equivalent experience.

Experience with validating data from various data sources; flat files and relational databases (often in the same project).

Experience in data mining or profiling using query tools such as SQL, Excel, etc.

Experience with stdin/stdout and/or Batch Scripting a plus.

Some Familiarity with Unix environment a plus.

Experience with Symitar PowerOn (formerly RepGen) a plus.
ONLY FULLY COMPLETED APLICATIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED*

**SEE RESUME ON APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED**

Description of Duties:
Business Vision and Strategy

â¿¢ Set data vision and direction for a dedicated business area (Students or Human Resources further outlined below).

â¿¢ Advocate and innovate in the use of data to advance the capabilities and mission of the business area.

â¿¢ Assist in the conceptualization, development, and refinement of district wide metrics to measure student progress and performance.

â¿¢ Maintain detailed data dictionary definitions for data assets and participate as a business area data steward in the college's data governance program to recommend standards, policies, and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the data collections used by the business area.

Data Analysis

â¿¢ Utilize SQL to source data and perform both recurring and ad hoc analytics as needed to support business operations as well as for data discovery and prototyping of data to evolve and advance business unit data collections.

Technical Collaboration

â¿¢ Collaborate with Data Engineering to design data models and other data solutions

â¿¢ Provide detailed requirements and context needed to facilitate Data Engineering's ability to quickly understand and incorporate business area data needs into Community College's award-winning data and analytics system.

â¿¢ Provides guidance on the identification of information that the business area produces and consumes, and assists with data rationalization and data sourcing.

Training

â¿¢ Develop training materials and lead both one-on-one and group training sessions to help business area users increase their ability to directly use data.

Ideal candidate will have 3+ years of relevant work experience in SQL required (intermediate level). Client utilizes Amazon's Redshift data warehouse. Analysts interact with it using standard PostreSQL (but any SQL experience is sufficient for this role)

Candidates must have proven work experience with data analysis. This could include anything from Excel up to statistical tools like SPSS or cloud based tools (GoogleRefine, Tableau Public, Google Fusion, etc.)There is one open Data Strategist role with a focus in Students. For example, past work experience in a college/university Registrar, Academic Affairs, or Marketing/Communications would be considered relevant. This individual should have recent high level work experience (Director, Chancellor, VP, etc.). Qualified resumes will outline past work experience working with IT to build reports and analyzing data.

The second open Data strategist role has a focus in Human Resources. This individual does not have to have an Education background. A highly qualified candidate will have EXTENSIVE Human Resources experience, in a variety of roles all related to Human Resources. Most recent HR experience should be a high level within an organization (in any industry). This individual should have past work experience in an HR capacity and resume should focus on their past work experience working with HR-specific data.

Both Data Strategists will be working on an analytical team with institutional researchers on a decision support team. There are already data analysts in place that will help to pull data on requests received. The Data Strategist is responsible for interpreting that data for the requestor. In addition, the Data Strategist will be promoting their capabilities to various departments within client, and making recommendations on how data can be used for business decisions. The Data Strategist will be working in a specific functional areas (HR or Students) and promoting the use of data, facilitating communication between functional area and data team. The Data Strategist will own a data strategy for their area as well as convey information to the data engineering team by bringing ideas forward from their functional area to their counterparts within the data team

Organization: Accenture Analytics
Location : San Francisco, San Jose, Seattle
Travel: 80-100% Travel Required
Position: Accenture Analytics - Data Science Analyst

The digital revolution is changing everything. Itâs everywhere â transforming how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital youâll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise, and insight clients depend on.

Accenture Digital is powered by three practices âMobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, youâll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. Youâll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues.
JOB DESCRIPTION

Your clientâs eyes probably glaze over when you discuss in detail logistic regression, cluster analysis, neural nets and other segmentation models, but they certainly appreciate your uncanny ability to utilize those to lower their marketing costs and improve marketing effectiveness. Or perhaps they rely on you to provide analytics that stimulate sales, strengthen customer loyalty and generate purchases. If youâve earned a reputation for your analytics expertise, Accenture may be the perfect place to take the next step in your career journey.
YOUR ROLE: Data Scientist

There will never be a typical day at Accenture Analytics, but thatâs why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing digital landscape. Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities.

Â· Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art, data-driven predictive/descriptive models to solve business problems using the latest and most appropriate technologies in statistical modeling and machine learning.

Â· Create new insights from predictive statistical modeling activities that target and deliver value to our clients.

Â· Manage, architect and analyze big data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact data models to generate significant business value.

Â· Create models and processes to collect, distill and interpret data with a view to aid better, more informed decision making.

Â· Examine and explore data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of discovering insights which in turn can provide competitive advantage for our clients. Basic Qualifications

Â· 2 years of experience with real data

Â· 1 year of experience with open source machine learning tools: Python/scikit-learn or Revo R.

Â· 1 year of experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash) for orchestration and data manipulation

Â· 1 year Data engineering experience, including SQL and experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis.

Â· Bachelorâs Degree in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied math, physics or relevant subjects or 4+ years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational discipline.
Preferred Skills

Â· Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solver

Â· Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations

Â· Experience with MapReduce/Hadoop and related technologies (e.g., Pig, Hive, Cascading).

Â· Familiarity with Amazon Web Services and Elastic MapReduce a plus.

Â· Familiarity with Hadoop based commercial packages (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks)

Â· Experience in text mining/NLP
OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU

Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement

Youâll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects.

Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company.

Access to leading-edge technology.

Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits http://careers.accenture.com/us-en/your-future/rewards-benefits/Pages/index.aspx
CALL TO ACTION
Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is hereâwhatâs stopping you from pursuing it?

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

The Audience Strategy and Development team at Sojern is responsible for managing global data partnerships & audience development with leading OTAs, airlines, hotels and other travel booking sites. We drive the global acquisition and use of data, as well as diversification in data sources.

As an important team member, you will help us analyze the impact of existing initiatives, deep-dive/root cause issues as they come up, develop new business metrics, identify and quantify opportunities for business development, and partner with internal stakeholders to help drive our data partnerships and audience business.

Translate reporting or business requirements into technical specifications

Must be familiar with Big Data and Google cloud data analysis tools
Experience with data extraction and reporting tools such as Tableau
Experience in web analytics and advertising operations
Experience with manipulating complex data to interpret results and create business insights
Ability to create multiple versions of reports targeted to different end users from middle managers to C-Suite
Excellent problem solving skills â creative, practical, thorough
Think strategically and execute methodically
Desire to roll up your sleeves and do what is needed to get the job done
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and comfortable presenting to small-medium groups

Experience with CRM and Marketing Automation tools like Salesforce, etc.

Opportunities: Be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow
Give Back: We give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations
Ownership: Lead innovative and challenging projects

Generous flexible vacation days

jobtitle: BI/SQL Data Analytics Consultant- Humana Pharmacy Solutions
job_summary:
Humana is seeking a Data Analytics Consultant for our Humana Pharmacy Solutions Team (HPS), who will provide an ongoing strategic view and direction to multiple initiatives. You will partner with project managers and project teams to define and meet project milestones and objectives.

In this role
the QlikView Developer will be part of a team working within the Data Solutions group focused on dashboards and reporting for the HPS businesses.
Part of the team responsible for producing dashboards and reports that provide data and various metrics.
You will interface with multiple groups to collect requirements, analyze the data, and work with teams who will interpret the information to provide direction to the business teams. The status of activities will be reported up through regular operational reports to executive leadership within the Company.
As a QlikView developer one of your main tasks will be to provide the data in a way that tells a story to everyone from the in-the-trenches application owner all the way up to executive leadership.
The role will require thought leadership and intuitive design to ensure the dashboards are simple to use yet flexible enough to allow users to get to the data they need without having to export data into Excel and other tools.
Key Competencies
Builds Trust:
Consistently models and inspires high levels of integrity, lives up to commitments, and takes responsibility for the impact of one's actions.
Interpersonal Effectiveness
: Understands oneself, effectively manages emotions, listens and communicates with respect, and builds trusting relationships.
Customer Focus
: Connects meaningfully with customers to build emotional engagement and customer advocacy. Simplifies complexity and integrates internal efforts to deliver an optimal customer experience.
Collaborates
: Engages others by gathering multiple views and being open to diverse perspectives, focusing on a shared purpose that puts Humana's overall success first.

Qualifications
Essentials:
Bachelorâs Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field
5+ years of experience in reporting with 4+ years of experience in QlikView design and development.
Experienced in data modeling, analysis, design, testing, development and implementation
Hands-on professional with thorough knowledge of data source integration
Expert in developing dashboard wireframes and design requirements based on technical and visual design considerations
Expert with QlikView scripting, QVD, QVW, and data loads
Expert in optimizing QlikView dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, and flexibility
Strong experience with RDBMS systems such as Microsoft SQL and/or Oracle DB
Some experience with QlikSense, QlikView installation, server side administration, and user administration
The ability to interpret report data and translate it into a business impact or strategic actions that need to occur
Technical problem-solving skills
Strong skills in project management methodologies and tools
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong presentation skills with the ability to present to large groups as well as senior leadership
Role Desirables
Masterâs Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field
Experience with pharmacy benefits and health benefits
Tableau experience a plus
Additional Information

Humana is an organization with careers that change livesâincluding yours. As an innovator in the fast-paced industry of healthcare, we offer our associates careers that challenge, support and inspire them to use their passion for helping others and to lead their best lives. If youâre ready to help people achieve lifelong well-being, and be a part of an organization that is growing and poised to make an impact on the future of healthcare, Humana has the right opportunity for you.

Apply now, or join our Talent Network so you can stay informed and up to date on whatâs happening at Humana.

AXA is looking for a Manager to provide people-related data and analyses focused on ensuring our HR organization, and our clients, are able to make thoughtful, data-driven decisions. A core purpose of the role is to develop, analyze and evaluate HR data to discover and present actionable approaches to key stakeholders and business leaders.

You will successfully develop workforce metrics and reporting dashboards/scorecards, all tied to business performance, functional objectives and workforce planning strategies. You will help map and improve processes, and will be a key data interface with other departments.
You will solve essential business challenges such as:Ensuring we have the right skills, capabilities, and availability of talent for the future
Predicting which of our applicants each year would make great hires
Creating an on-going reporting environment that builds confidence that surfaces issues quickly
Other key business issues where data might give us greater leverage.

We're looking for someone who is able to tie business strategy to talent strategy and loves digging into numbers, building models, designing impactful data visualization and strong communications. You will have the ability to balance multiple priorities, possess deep analytical rigor, and have excellent written and visual communication skills. You will be working in a data-rich environment with source data from Finance, HR, and other systems.
Key Responsibilities :
The manager will work closely with the HR team on a wide range of analytical and project management functions to empower organizational decision-making with high quality data, including:
research on trending skills and capabilities, key talent and retention strategies, drivers of engagement and the employee value proposition
analysis of large data sets to distill insights and connect disparate ideas into cohesive recommendations and executive presentations
preparation of workforce projections
liaising with other AXA entities to produce/maintain communication materials to convey methodology

o coordinate meetings with global and local workforce planning leads
design and tracking of project plans to ensure completion of key milestones; integrate with other business processes
automation of workforce metrics and dashboards to deliver insights at scale
data quality processes and consistent use and adoption of measures, hierarchies, tools and reporting standards.
approach for predictive analytics, including data requirements, trade-offs in analytical methods, and interpretation of results
creation of models to assess trends, project needs, surface challenges, and estimate costs

Qualifications

BA/BS in Economics, Industrial/Organization Psychology, Finance, Mathematics or applied sciences + 4-7 years of experience in HR Analytics, Data Science, or Business Analytics OR MS and 2 years of experience in HR Analytics, Data Science or Business Analytics in an enterprise setting.

Skills and experience
Experience using quantitative and qualitative analytical strategies and working with multiple data sources to generate insights from analyses (e.g. dashboards, tables, metrics), answering questions or creating solutions, and manipulating data (e.g., check for data issues, clean, merge) to measure the effectiveness of programs and interventions.
Experience using data visualization (e.g., tables, charts, graphs) to represent analyses to an executive audience. Experience with Tableau is desirable.
Passion for bringing data to life with the ability to simplify and present information in a logical, concise & compelling manner
Superior learning agility with the ability to learn independently from a variety of sources; ability to thrive in ambiguous situations
Able to understand strategic objectives and translate into delivery via compelling, well framed presentations
Flexible, collaborative attitude with ability to shift from strategic thinking to rolling up your sleeves with functional teams
A strong sense of curiosity about the world and social behavior
Effective oral communication; superior written communication skills
Advanced Excel and Power Point skills
Results and execution oriented

Preferred
Experience using SQL, Python or other equivalent language, statistical packages (e.g., SPSS, R, MatLab), and data modeling. Experience building and maintaining a solution to collect, store, and organize data to address client needs.

Other information
NOTE: AXA participates in the E-Verify program.

In addition to competitive compensation and an outstanding benefits package including 401 (k) and medical programs, we offer the opportunity for continued professional development in a congenial corporate environment.

AXA is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to our employees, applicants and candidates based on individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, mental or physical disabilities, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information or any other class protected by federal, state and local laws.

Job Title: Data Analyst
Department: Corporate
Reports To: Director of Operational Finance and Analysis
FLSA Status: Exempt

Summary

Responsible for monitoring purchasing, inventory and sales activities to ensure contracted pricing is delivered and company goals are met. Analyze data from multiple systems to identify and report on possible opportunities and ensure data integrity. Communicate findings with office and warehouse management teams.

Responsibilities

Analyze purchasing needs to minimize out of stocks and maximize goals for multiple locations.

Monitor for compliance with contract terms, policies and procedures.

Coordinate purchase activities with warehouse managers and distributors to maintain planned inventory levels, maximize sales, reduce shrink and minimize obsolete inventory.

Research, retrieve, and analyze sales data to track, measure and optimize margin improvement opportunities.

Leverage available data to engage with manufacturers on promotional opportunities.

Provide monthly summary reports to manufacturers regarding program specific requirements.

Maintaining data in multiple systems for both internal and external customers.

Develop, analyze and distribute company report card to upper management.

Qualifications

High School Diploma or GED required

Bachelorâs degree in business administration or related field preferred

Three years of experience in purchasing, procurement or data analytics

Previous industry experience in vending, warehousing, distribution or foodservice with multiple locations and products preferred.

Ability to prioritize, multi-task and maintain flexibility in a fast-paced, service-oriented environment

Proven analytical and problem solving skills

Strong attention to detail

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

Excellent communication skills

Assist with creating a data architectural strategy to develop a strong, and reliable data pipeline. Resource would be responsible for improving data quality, documentation, modelling, and drive the adoption of a process around creating new data sources and bringing in new data for analytics.

Resource would also work with clients to target areas where workflow could be improved by data driven insights and create data tools / statistical modelling / reporting.

Who Mattersight is:

The rubber hits the road when someone picks up the phone to talk to a company. It happens over 250 million times a day. With over 60 percent of people dumping brands because of bad customer service, that phone call can make or break a business.

Enter Mattersight â the only company that uses personality analysis and big data analytics to improve every customer call, increase customer satisfaction and lower costs for Fortune 500 enterprises. Our patented technology mines a private database of over 1 billion customer service calls to quickly pair customers with call center agents they will naturally, effortlessly click with. Awkward and annoying becomes satisfying and enjoyable. Frustrated becomes enthusiastic.

Mattersight helps companies make positive conversations with their customers the rule, not the exception by fostering emotional connections that turn complainers into fans.
Responsibilities & Qualifications:
Who you are:

Mattersight is seeking a leader for a newly formed Insights and Analytics team. The ideal candidate is excited about working with clients to help them leverage data and analytics to grow revenue, reduce cost, and improve customer experience.

We are looking for an individual with 6+ years of related work experience who is energized by the prospect of partnering with clients to drive value. The ideal candidate has a track record of analyzing data to find actionable insight and value that is not readily apparent. The candidate is equally comfortable with clients and spreadsheets, can synthesize and present information, coach others, and can build repeatable processes. The role will be challenging, but will reward those who thrive in a fast-paced, client-focused, and entrepreneurial environment.

What youâll do:

The leader of the Insights and Analytics will leverage Mattersightâs capability to solve customer problems and find new insights from the data within Mattersightâs solutions. Mattersight captures millions of customer interactions and analyzes them, turning conversations into analyzable data. The successful candidate will manage a team chartered to create consistent reporting and analytical output and work with our Customer Success team to analyze data and find insights into our customersâ operations and the customer experience they create. The Insights and Analytics leader is responsible for, but not limited to, the following tasks: Work with Mattersight customers on specific engagements to uncover insights and unlock value from data. Work closely with Mattersightâs Business Intelligence, Data Science, and Linguistics teams to produce analysis. Create a structured approach to finding insight and build a team that enables experience from one customer to be leveraged across many. Support Mattersightâs Customer Success and Account teams to retain and grow accounts.
What you definitely have:

include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

egular attendance, punctuality and adherence to agreed-upon schedule of availability are conditions of employment and essential function of this position.
