Job Description:

NASCAR seeks a talented professional to join our team in the position of Manager, Consumer Research based in our Charlotte, NC office.

The Manager, Consumer Research is responsible for leading qualitative and quantitative market research activities and insights to drive success for The Company and key external partners. Primary role is creating and developing thorough insights on current and future on attitudinal, lifestyle and cross-consumption landscape metrics. This position will be accountable to be the voice of the fan for the industry, building and managing insight dashboards and reports, interacting with stakeholders across the industry, and helping to drive strategies with executives.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Provide key insights to internal as well as external stakeholders (including teams, tracks, sponsors, and other industry partners) to assist in meeting various goals and objectives.
C reat e and develop thorough insights on current and future fans on attitudinal, lifestyle and cross-consumption landscape metrics.
Educate internal customers on research process, including cost estimates, timing, deliverables, etc.
Extensive data mining capabilities to uncover trends in data, sub-groups of interest, social media habits, longitudinal data, and other key insights to assist internal and external partners on understanding fan attitudes and behaviors. Utilization of SPSS and Excel to drive advanced statistical analysis.
Assist in managing a proprietary panel consisting of avid fans. Results of research conducted are reported to executives and used to evaluate the health of the sport.
Lead ad-hoc research requests/projects from start to finish, recommending the appropriate methodologies, managing RFP process and vendor selection, designing research and conducting data analysis, reporting, and presenting key insights.
Serve as internal expert on fans and enable decision makers to make informed business decisions through research findings and actionable insights.
Manage vendor relationships to optimize data quality, available tools and services and cost management.
Utilize syndicated research from partners such as Simmons, Nielsen Scarborough, Nielsen Sports, etc. to provide consumer composition, behavioral/attitudinal insights and identify business opportunities.
Create impactful, relevant and visually appealing research summaries and dashboards highlighting key insights.
Complete research assessments on new research companies/products while managing select vendor relationships to optimize data quality, available tools/services and cost management.
Integrate and work directly with other Analytics and Insights team members and other internal groups.
Work effectively in a collaborative team environment while possessing a high level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Percentage of travel: 10% including some weekends
QUALIFICATIONS
Critical thinker, able to sort through complex business issues to develop research plans
Demonstrated ability to translate research data into actionable insights and recommendations
Able to think out of the box and willing to try different research approaches
Proven ability to effectively manage conflict and demonstrated partnering skills
Ability to handle complex data sets through strong analytical skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills
Ability to handle multiple projects/tasks simultaneously
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university plus 4 (4) yearsâ experience; or five (5) yearsâ experience and/or training in Market or Media Research or related fields; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in the sports and/or entertainment industry preferred.

Job Description

Want to analyze numbers and curate data with one of the leading data companies in Seattle? We are looking for a self-motivated Data Analyst with a passion for solving analytical problems and communicating nuanced findings to non-technical audiences . If this sounds like you, come join our Data Analytics team based in Pioneer Square! Our data and software are revolutionizing the compensation world with a crowd-sourced and machine-learned approach to salary data analysis. As a data driven company, our data is our lifeblood and we want someone to join us in the journey of discovering what amazing things it has to offer.

What youâll do
Participate in creating innovative and highly visible analyses of work trends and compensation, like PayScale's Gender Pay Gap Package .
Select and analyze data subsets of the PayScale database of over 54 million profiles, using our real-time data analysis system.
Find trends, stories, and highlights in a large multivariate dataset.
Partner with PayScaleâs marketing team to brainstorm concepts, craft research questions for the PayScale salary survey, and produce clean data visualizations to present the data.
Work with media partners and journalists to understand their information requirements and provide the needed data or analysis.
May w ork with the broader data analytics team responsible for several areas of our business, including data health and wealth, our proprietary compensation model (currently supporting over 5,0 00 customers and millions of website visitors), business intelligence analytics, and survey design.
May develop analytical and statistical approaches to answer business questions, examine data validity, and report on interesting data subjects.
Receive a personalized unicorn avatar. Qualifications

What youâll need

A bachelorâs degree (preferably from the sociology, psychology, anthropology, political science, or economics) with substantial quantitative coursework.
0-1 years of experience.
Excitement about both data and information design.
A desire to craft informative, easy-to-use, a nd highly intriguing data visualizations, after completing any necessary training.
Experience creating quantitative answers to questions of business interest.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Well-organized and detail-oriented, with good time management skills.
Able to work independently in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up environment.
Proficiency in Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, D3, etc.) is a plus.

Additional Information

PayScale is an equal opportunity employer â Minority/Female/Veteran/Disability, we provide a place where employees of all backgrounds can build a successful career.

About PayScale
We are committed to providing a true work-life balance and we offer competitive vacation and flex time to support that. We work hard, but still want coworkers to be able to have interesting lives outside of the office. Our team includes a certified Zumba instructor, an all-star soccer player and coach, a Jeopardy master/Bachelorette superfan, an ultramarathoner, an ageless wonder, and more. Oh so much more.
We maintain a supportive, inclusive, and laid-back work environment, because stress is the enemy of creativity.
We support employees who want to take part in charitable giving, in all scopes of life.
We have a broad mix of optional-but-encouraged fun company activities available: holiday parties, family picnics, zoo trips, coffee carts, Halloween costume contests, and more!
We believe we are the ideal company for somebody who wants to avoid the bureaucracy that comes with huge organizations and the risk and stressful work hours of tiny startups. Come to a place where your ideas are valued, your brain is challenged, your voice is heard and your work has an immediate impact.

Pay is a Package!

Mothers' Room

Senior Data Architect (JID 6022)

Analyst/Programmer

IT Data and Analytics

Full Time / $6249 - $8500 / mo.

NOTE: IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR ANY OF OUR POSTED VACANCIES, PLEASE COMPLETE THE CSUN ON-LINE APPLICATION PROCESS HERE: HTTP: //BIT.LY/HR_CSUN

CSUN's Commitment to You

CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity. Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining a respectful and inclusive work environment.

About the University

Serving approximately 40,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States, and it has an impact to match its size. Money Magazine recently named CSUN one of the top ten values in all of higher education, and the Social Mobility Index ranked CSUN fifth in the nation for elevating its students, economic and social well-being. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI) and an Asian American, Native American, Pacific Islander Serving Institution (AANAPISI) and we value the diversity of all of our students and the campus community. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.

Major Duties

Under general supervision, the Senior Data Architect serves as a data modeler to enable integration of data from various data sources, including learning management system, student information system, and other institutional applications to produce reports and dashboards in support of organizational needs; serves as a liaison with user areas to understand their analytics and reporting needs; plays a key role in all aspects of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes; serves as a backup report writer using Tableau/OBIEE; designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and implements ETL software code; translates high-level requirements into development tasks; estimates tasks based on technical debt, level of effort and complexity; works in a fast paced, team environment with multiple deadlines; and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a job-related field. Five (5) years of full-time, field-related experience, which includes 4 years hands-on ETL experience using tools such as Data Stage, Informatica or ODI, SQL writing and database programming, and experience with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) such as Oracle, SQL Server, or similar databases.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

Extensive knowledge of: data warehousing concepts; data validation, testing and support activities. Functional knowledge of higher education data and HR data is desirable. Familiarity with Tableau, OBIEE, and academic technologies, especially with Canvas LMS, is essential. Ability and specialized skills to: code, test, and debug software applications; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; communicate effectively both orally and in writing; develop and make presentations; conduct meetings; develop and provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Highly self-motivated team-player with positive "can do" attitude

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

The university offers an excellent benefits package.

The salary range for this classification is: $6249 - $10,857 per month.

The anticipated hiring range: $6249 - $8500, dependent upon qualifications and experience.

The candidate will be expected to deliver high-quality Business Intelligence and report consulting services to a range of internal customers.

The position will have two primary responsibilities. The first primary responsibility includes supporting ERP conversion activities with extract, transform, load (ETL) of legacy data. The candidate will be responsible for creating repeatable, validated data conversion methodologies and will handle data from various legacy ERP systems. Data may be in the format of excel files, text reports, text based flat files, SQL Server databases, Access databases, etc. The second primary responsibility includes the aggregation and normalization of data across systems. The focus of this data is centered around SKU sales and purchasing volume information. The candidate should have experience aggregating data from multiple systems and producing consolidated, repeatable reporting tools.

In addition to these primary responsibilities, the position will provide ongoing maintenance to existing data collection, consolidation, and reporting tools.

The candidate must be an excellent communicator (both orally and written) and be able to effectively foster interactive collaboration and discussions among IT peers and internal customers. Also, the Analyst must be able to present conclusions in a logical and clear manner and must be able to effectively work as part of a team.
Responsibilities:
Support ERP conversions with ETL of data from legacy ERP systems into the Catalyst ERP system.
Support the Supply Chain project teams with consolidation, reporting, and analysis of SKU movement data.
Gather requirements, analyze, create, and produce specialized presentations and reports that answer the business questions of our internal customers.
Build reports in Excel, Access, Tableau, and Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services using templates, documents, and T-SQL.
Track and manage US LBMâs suite of reports, both standard, custom and outgoing data feeds.
Identify additional data, reporting and analytic needs internal customers and scope work necessary to fulfill them.
Identify, define, and coordinate with other departments to connect our data and reporting to improve US LBMâs suite of products and services.
Develop new and innovative data, reporting and analytic products and services, as necessary.
Work with programming environments, SQL, SSRS, Excel, Access and Cyber Query platforms.
Any other tasks or projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.
Qualifications:
Bachelorâs degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering or similar discipline.
Solid technical writing skills; ability to clearly and completely articulate work to be done and describe tasks using proper terminology.
Experience interpreting data and presenting meaningful, client-ready business insights.
Demonstrated application of Analytical skills.
Advanced Excel and/or Access skills. (e.g., VLOOKUP, SUMIF, Macros)
Knowledge of the building materials distribution industry highly desirable.

Position Description Save lives. Fulfill yours. At the American Cancer Society, saving lives is our mission. We achieve our mission by drawing on our humanity.

Humanity made up of courage, determination, innovation, passion, empathy, and caring. These are the values that give us the advantage over cancer. Our work is important. And so are the people doing it.

The people who work at the American Cancer Society focus their diverse talents on our singular mission: to end the pain and suffering of cancer. It is a calling. And the people who answer it are fulfilled. We value our employees and nearly 2 million volunteers around the globe that have stood with us through the years, and we will not rest until the fight is won.

And that day is drawing nearer. The Sustainable Business and Innovation (SB&I) Advanced Analytics Team provides trusted, fact based analysis to inform better business decisions that make Nike more profitable and sustainable. Most recently, the team defined multiple scenarios about how Nike could halve its environmental impact over the next decade as its business doubles. As our Advanced Analytics Sr. Manager, you will combine a deep understanding of Nikeâs business, products and processes with advanced analytical techniques to provide easily understood insights and recommendations to key decision makers.

You will creatively mesh sustainability principles with your limitless curiosity and powerful analytical skills to recommend workable solutions to key sustainability challenges. Examples of the project-driven work will include; evaluation of the financial, environmental and performance impacts of Nike materials and product innovations, data mining Nikeâs material & product systems to identify Nikeâs key sustainability impacts and the leverage points to reduce them, accurately portraying the environmental and social dimensions of business decisions, and creating predictive models that portray Nikeâs business now and in the future. The ideal candidate will have a technical background in science or engineering with a diverse business experience inside and outside of Nike. The role will be most satisfying to a lifelong learner with a proven ability to develop paths through ambiguous situations that produce high quality, actionable results.
Keys to success are the ability to: work as a selfless collaborator on a small team, partner with multiple stakeholders across all levels of the Nike matrix, use systems thinking to frame-up and solve problems, and communicate complex ideas in simple ways. The role requires an ability to discover, blend, manipulate and create insights from a multitude of data sources. This is a dynamic, innovative, fast-paced role for someone who is comfortable leading change while delivering business results.

Amazon.comâs Transaction Risk Management Services (TRMS) mission is to make Amazon the safest and most trusted place worldwide to transact online. Amazon runs one of the most dynamic e-commerce marketplaces in the world, with nearly 2 million sellers worldwide selling hundreds of millions of items in ten countries. TRMS safeguards every financial transaction across all Amazon sites. As such, TRMS designs and builds the software systems, risk models and operational processes that minimize risk and maximize trust in Amazon.com. TRMS organization is looking for a Research Scientist for its Operations Analytics team. The team is being grown to provide insights about its TRMS operations and provide analytical solutions to help drive operational efficiencies, uncover the hidden risks and trends, reduce investigation errors and bad debt, improve customer experience and predict & recommend the optimizations for future state of TRMS operations.

As a Business Intelligence/Research Scientist, you will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, machine learning, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. You will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to solve problems, create operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. The candidate should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in concise and effective manner. As well, the candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business.
Responsibilities:
Use predictive analytics and machine learning techniques to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
Employ the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns of risks, abuse and help reduce bad debt
Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build actionable models to optimize TRMS operations
Solve analytical problems, and effectively communicate methodologies and results
Build predict models to forecast risks for product launches and operations and help predict workflow and capacity requirements for TRMS operations
Draw inferences and conclusions, and create dashboards and visualizations of processed data, identify trends, anomalies
Work closely with internal stakeholders such as business teams, engineering teams, and partner teams and align them with respect to your focus area

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in CS, Math, Statistics or a quantitative field
3+ years of hands-on experience in predictive modeling and analysis
3+ years of hands on experience with one of the statistical software tools: R, Python or SAS
3+ years of writing complex SQL queries in a high volume database environment

Preferred Qualifications

Experience/Knowledge of machine learning techniques such as GBM, random forest etc
Experience in e-commerce / on-line companies in fraud / risk control functions
Coding skills in one of the modern languages Java, Python, Scala
Experience with visualization technologies such as Tableau
Experience in statistical techniques such as classification, clustering, regression, statistical inference, collaborative filtering, and natural language processing, experimental design, social networking analysis, feature engineering etc.
Compelling communication and influencing skills and participation in winning the support of management and influence the course of major strategic decisions

The Kindle Content Risk Management team is looking for a customer-obsessed data scientist to help us exceed our goals. Experience with large data sets, experiment design and analysis
Creation and implementation of statistical predictive models including such algorithms as decision trees, regression, clustering, association, factor analytic techniques, etc
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner with both technical and non-technical customers Â· Superior verbal and written communication skills, ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts

Â· Ability to create server-based dashboard reports or other types of data visualizations/reporting using Tableau or other similar applications

WorldCover sells crop insurance to farmers in the developing world. Our mission is to help the hundreds of millions of families and small businesses manage risk from natural disasters and climate change. We already provide crop insurance to 20,000 farmers in Africa and have backing on our investment platform from a $10B institutional investor.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with strong Engineering capabilities who can help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products to the hundreds of millions of people worldwide in our target markets.
We are a for-profit Public Benefit Corporation headquartered in New York City. Our team comprises two co-founders in NYC plus 10 salaried staff in Ghana. We are backed by a group of global venture capital investors, such as Index Ventures, Venrock, Fintech Collective, Greylock Partners, and Y Combinator.

The opportunity
:

We are looking for a talented data scientist who is excited to tackle the challenges unique to our markets:
Reaching customers in low-tech environments
Analyzing unstructured geospatial and socioeconomic datasets
Performing machine-learning on socioeconomic customer data to optimize our sales process
Keeping apace with rapid innovations in global remote-sensing data sets

Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products.
Your responsibilities include:Selecting features, building, and optimizing classifiers on best customers using machine learning techniques to enhance our sales distribution techniques
Creating automated dashboards and tracking systems to measure real-time progress of our sales activities on the ground
Integrating cutting edge remote sensing data and predictive analytics to improve our product suite
Working with our COO and Lead Engineer to build, scale, and maintain our central database
Extending companyâs data sets with third party sources of information when needed
Enhancing and automating data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems

Specific projects include, but are not limited to, the following:
Integrating remote sensing data such as rainfall, temperature, humidity, elevation etc. to create parametric drought and flood insurance products that minimize the error function with observed crop yields
Optimizing customer data collection processes and analyzing data sets to create an intelligent and automated sales process, which can answer, but are not limited to, the following questions:
which customers or communities to target on which days,
how often we should target them,
what messages we should target them with.
Requirements:Excellent understanding of and experience with common data science toolkits, especially R, but including Weka, NumPy, or Julia
Production-level programming skills in Python or other scripting languages
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL. Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, RethinkDB, Cassandra, HBase
Excellent understanding of and experience with machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests
Expertise in applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regressions
Great communication skills and data-oriented personality
Additionally valuable are:Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot
Practical experience with cloud based big data solutions, like Amazon Redshift or Google BigQuery
Experience with architecting and building SQL/NoSQL databases
Knowledge or experience with GIS and/or climate data sets
Benefits:
Competitive salary and equity in a growing, early stage, well-funded company
Opportunities for international travel
Direct impact across hundreds of thousands of individuals affected by climate change

jobtitle: Strategy and Planning Project Leader or Manager (quantitative analysis)
job_summary:
STRATEGY AND PLANNING TEAM OVERVIEW:
The Strategy and Planning team at Ropes & Gray plays an essential role in directly supporting the firmâs leadership on a broad range of strategic and change management initiatives essential to Ropes & Grayâs practices, offices, and staff functions. The team is comprised of approximately 10 individuals who collaborate on projects and hail from a variety of backgrounds that include management consulting, finance, and law. The team leverages its depth and breadth of problem solving, market research, business analysis, and quantitative analysis skills to help the firmâs leaders address strategic challenges and capture new growth opportunities. In doing so, team members are afforded exciting professional development opportunities by working on a wide range of strategic projects, which may include, for example, developing a geography-based strategy for one of Ropes & Grayâs existing eleven offices or a potentially new office, assisting a practice by analyzing its performance along a set of complex metrics, or working with practice leaders to identify new differentiated service offerings that address evolving client needs.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Strategy and Planning Project Leader or Manager will be involved in leading a variety of business analyses focused on addressing the firmâs core strategic imperatives. The work will be project-based and will involve multi-tasking and working closely with partners and staff. The Strategy and Planning Project Leader or Manager will manage these projects through their entire cycle including scoping and initial data gathering, analysis, result interpretation, result presentation, action plan development, and operationalization. This job should be most appealing to those individuals who have a solid background in financial and business analysis and are energized by project-based work that includes multiple decision-makers and stakeholders.
Role specifics:Project leadership:
Scope out analyses, develop methodologies, assign tasks, propose priorities, manage communication with team members and customers, monitor progress to timelines, and drive work to completion

Ensure highest level of accuracy, organization, documentation, communication, and follow-through on all projects
Scoping and work planning:
Scope out projects in a methodical, concise, and clear manner

Prepare detailed work plans for projects, including schedules, resources, and dependencies

Develop detailed hypotheses and questions to be explored and outline the approach to address each one
Data gathering:
Compile and synthesize information from internal and external sources, both directly and through guidance of analysts and other staff

Understand internal data sources, data structures, and how to query them
Data analysis and modeling:
Analyze quantitative and qualitative business information and data in a structured way to find patterns and relationships

Design, build, and maintain complex Excel-based models to explore historical trends, build forecasts, and model scenarios

Guide and collaborate with other team members on designing, building, and maintaining complex Excel-based models to explore historical trends, build forecasts, and model scenarios

Develop logical methodologies to address and answer complex business hypotheses or questions through analytics
Result synthesis and decision support:
Translate analytical results into actionable findings for decision makers

Develop effective management presentation materials based on findings, including professional and flawless display of information, clear logic and storylines, using written, slide, and oral formats

Respond to follow-on requests from internal customers in a timely, professional, and collaborative manner
Relationship building:
Develop trusted advisor relationships with internal customers across practices and management

Espouse a collaborative approach to working across functions, consistent with Ropes & Grayâs culture of teaming and collegiality
Supervision and mentoring:
Develop more junior team members, which may not be direct reports, and support their professional growth

Mentor and teach others across the organization
General:
Demonstrate solid judgment about priorities and timing

Perform other work-related duties as assigned
REQUIREMENTS: EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, AND CAPABILITIES

This is a demanding position. We are looking for a unique individual to fill it. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, patience, poise, and presence with the ability to influence and interact with senior level management as well as junior staff. The candidate must have a demonstrated track record of successfully leading analytical projects and making an impact in a decentralized environment, preferably within a professional services firm.

MBA (or similar advanced professional degree)

Minimum 8 years of related experience, demonstrating strong analytical skills and leadership. Title and level will be dependent upon extent of relevant professional experience

Experience within law firms or the professional services industry a plus

Function productively in a decentralized environment, with track record of patiently gaining buy-in and consensus in diverse settings

Superb direct and indirect management skills

Patience with change and the a bility to conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines

Strong aptitude for analytical work and demonstrated strengths in problem solving and logical thinking

Work in a self-directed manner to produce accurate, flawless, well-documented work products with strict attention to detail and complete follow-up and follow through.

Work effectively in a team environment. Must be team-oriented and able to share information, goals, opportunities, successes and failures with the appropriate parties

Multi-task and effectively prioritize under time sensitive and often demanding schedules and where multiple projects are pursued concurrently

Strong written and verbal communication skills, excellent interpersonal and organizational skills

Strict attention to confidentiality

Interact effectively with all levels of personnel, including partners, senior management staff, and support staff

Proficient in utilizing technology effectively. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are required. Experience with Business Intelligence (such as Business Objects, Elite Enterprise, and Tableau) tools is preferred

Willing to work beyond traditional business hours when necessary

Work effectively in a culturally and educationally diverse environment
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:
Please include a cover letter with application.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Normal office environment. Incumbent is expected to work the hours necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of the position.

The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of essential functions, responsibilities or requirements.

Provide franchise and brand specific I&A leadership: Recognized as an internal âThought Leaderâ and expert in the field of Insights & Analytics as evidence by their participation in key strategic projects and involvement in key external advisory panels. The key problem solving partner to the relevant franchises and brands by establishing strong relationships with key business leaders and partnering with them in understanding their unique business challenges. Translate the business needs into actionable analytic-focused initiatives to provide solutions and/or recommendations to enable the business excellence.

Shape the vision for and lead the integrated I&A plan for a business/franchise: Develop a vision, and priorities for the I&A team based on needs of the BU, I&A vision, input from team and stakeholders; generate momentum for a shared vision and roadmap with the team.
Coach, guide and manage I&A work streams: Ensure operations team focuses on critical business questions, drives towards strategic and synthesized insights, and suggests ideas and recommendations that enable better decision-making for the business. Work with the Head of Business Analytics to coach the operations team to prioritize work and enable effective support by our associates in Hyderabad.
Advise, guide and steward strategic I&A work streams: (Level II) Operate as a thought leader/partner with the SI&A operations team to foster the development of creative solutions for complex & emerging analytic needs where established principles do not exist(e.g. integrating predictive analytics/machine learning into existing business processes to enhance the effectiveness of sales and marketing). Solve critical business questions by guiding team to deliver strategic and synthesized insights which enable better decision-making for the business. Work with the Head of Business Analytics to coach the operations team to prioritize work and enable effective support by our associates in Hyderabad.
Lead periodic âdeep-divesâ for the BU: (Level I) Lead the synthesis of insights/analytics on a periodic basis (e.g., quarterly, once in six months). Work with operations team on pulling together the story, âso-whatâs, âwhat-nextsâ. Syndicate with key stakeholders prior to discussion.

Lead strategic business initiatives and sell recommendations to PEC/ECN decision makers: (Level II) Structure and Lead the strategic business initiatives (e.g., incremental significant investment requiring divisional/enterprise approval). Lead operations team on developing the story, âso-whatâs, âwhat-nextsâ, business case and recommendation. Syndicate with key senior level stakeholders (Executive Committee & Global) and reconcile competing/conflicting feedback prior to discussion/review.
Provide hands-on support to the BU: Provide hands-on support to the BU on a specific brand(s) or topics, ad hoc requests or targeted analysis. As needed, play the role of a âplayerâ or a âdoerâ, not just an integrator/director of work from the team.

Steward Insights and data spend (market research budget, data spend) for the BU: Maintain transparency into market research budgets, where and how resources are deployed, areas of improvement/productivity, and impact. Also prioritize data spend (current and requested), challenge areas for continuous improvement.

Maintain full compliance with internal and external guidelines: Stay current on external and internal guidelines, develop training and approaches for Integrated Team (where needed) to understand and fully comply with compliance requirements. Partner with relevant interval departments (e.g., E&C)
Work across Novartis: Partner with other Novartis commercial teams and business partners (e.g., on US cross-divisional initiatives, understanding how they generate/implement insights), departments (e.g., sourcing, Finance, Managed Markets); develop counseling and working relationships across departments and with Brand team members
Functional Thought Leadership across Novartis(Level II): Represent US SI&A as a on globally sponsored initiatives involving global PLS leadership and BU leadership to drive strategic capability development for the enterprise

Integrate and communicate franchise I&A impact to PLS leadership, across other functional areas, with senior leadership: For example, develop succinct senior executive communications on impact (e.g., questions addressed, ideas generated, innovative tools, approaches; areas of impact)

Novartis is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

EEO Statement

The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Minimum requirements

Bachelorâs Degree in Science (e.g., Biology, Medical, Biomedical, Bio Engineering), Business, Statistics/Operations Research/Mathematics, Market Research

MBA preferred (Advanced degree required Level II)

Background in social sciences, anthropology or other related field that bring a different perspective and insights preferred

Experience in Brand Marketing and/or other Business areas preferred (e.g., Managed Markets, Sales, Sales Ops)

Fluent in English

Minimum 12+ years of overall pharmaceutical industry experience, majority in the US, including specialty pharma experience (injected, infused, biologics and/or institutional products)

Minimum 5 years in marketing and/or marketing research and/or analytics or related experience involving: framing of strategic questions to be solved, generating insights (primary research or secondary analytics), synthesizing implications, driving for practical/actionable solutions, measuring impact

Experience launching products in the US (preferred)

Cross-functional experience preferred (e.g., managed markets, pricing, medical, analytics, sales, marketing)

Solid understanding of research methods, experimental design (quantitative and qualitative) and specialty pharma, hospital data sources

Solid understanding of analytics, databases (e.g., IMS, APLD) in the pharma industry

Minimum 3 years doing analytics in pharma

Strategic thinking

Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to translate a complex reports and analysis into simple âbusiness speakâ and present results to internal clients up to the executive level

Business Acumen - ability to connect the dots and generate insights, prioritize business questions and recommendations
Learning agility: ability to pick up new trends and learn quickly

Demonstrated partnering and influencing skills, stakeholder management, project management, people management

Business and technical problem solving

jobtitle: Mgr CSC Perf and Inbound Logistics
job_summary:
Primary responsibilities include for the Manager, Inbound Logistics and Performance Management are:
1. The position is directly accountable for the Inbound logistics packaging transportation for the entire network. Leadership, management and development of 3 transportation professionals and all outsourced functions including the Transportation Performance Management team.

2. Responsible for developing, implementing and driving MillerCoors Inbound logistics strategy and execution consisting of managing all truck load freight that moves from a domestic supplier or warehouse through to breweries. Also responsible for developing & managing data systems, reporting and analytics for the entire Transportation and Logistics breadth of network - $600M spend.

3. Focus on continuous improvement of logistics processes and communication with carriers.
Ensure team is integrated and aligned with Customer Service, Breweries, DCâs, transportation providers & distributors Develop and manage domestic and international carrier network to deliver superior service $600M spend, 600K shipments, 280K miles 6 Suppliers across 25 location, 8 big domestic breweries, 5 craft / micro breweries, 9 import supply breweries Providing strategic and tactical direction for 3 rd Party Logistics providers for transportation planning and execution

4. Leads a team responsible for Transportation Performance Management:
Overall Logistics and Transportation data management that supports improved performance and makes MillerCoors easier to do business with and shipper of choice Metrics development; and reporting of all measures tied to Logistics and Transportation including Monthly Scorecard and Carrier Performance Scorecards, including key performance indicators with provided recommendations for areas of focus and improvement. Executing IT initiatives that streamline and automate current manual processes Develops and implements data management and reporting strategies that leverage available system data and functionality not currently being utilized including load builder and TPVS to allow for load smoothing; load utilization to improve load weights; maintenance of accurate master data to streamline reporting; and other related issues in support of the business.

5. Cost effective execution of the transportation and logistics function is paramount to the success of the overall supply chain and distributor service model while maintaining highest service and quality levels

6. The position is responsible for engineering inbound logistics solutions for brewery operations, carriers and suppliers

7. The position is responsible for developing and managing network of both strategic and tactical carriers & suppliers including the following;

Develop a multi-modal network including Over the Road, Ocean, LTL, Dedicated fleets, services, 3rd Party Logistics providers, etc. to deliver the Integrated Supply Chainâs annual plan to service - 65MM bbls/$173MM weekly revenue/approx. 4,000 weekly truckload shipments

Provide leadership and direction during annual planning process and freight bidding process. Conduct rate negotiations with strategic and tactical suppliers annually and as required

Responsible for supplier management and performance working closely with Logistics Strategy & Controls Manager to ensure that MillerCoors has a competitively advantaged carrier network

Education level and/or experience

Preferred 7 to 10 Years transportation/logistics, warehousing supply chain preferably in the beverage industry and/or consumer products.

Bachelors Degree or MBA in Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing, Industrial Engineering or Business.
Skills and/or knowledge

Expert knowledge and full understanding of key economic drivers in truck, rail and third party suppliers this includes, fuel, base rates, service bundles and pertinent legal and government requirements. Complete understanding of the interdependencies within the integrated supply chain

Organizational and leadership skill to lead multi-divisional activities, analyze large volumes of information, evaluate and resolve complex issues in rapidly changing environment.
Other requirements

Working knowledge of technology and systems application and interdependencies across the transportation and logistics and into the broader supply chain and linkages to the company. Detailed knowledge of supply chain/logistics systems and processes.

Exceptional negotiation and conflict resolution skills managing external suppliers/partners including transportation companies and public warehousing, operating with a sense of urgency.

Expert ability to collaborate with peers and executives in Field Sales, Finance, Supply Chain and external suppliers to drive new competencies, capabilities and cost savings.

Commercial awareness and business acumen.

Solid customer service focus and Enterprise Mindset

Strong understanding and the ability to champion transportation and logistics performance measures that are focused on outside to inside results.

Expert skill and ability to quickly assess situations, identify root causes, generate multiple ideas and solutions and make sound recommendations and decisions with a sense of urgency.

We are EA

And we make games â how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the

most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. Thatâs

why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry.

The EA Digital Platform Intelligent Systems Group is responsible for providing unified AI resources across

all franchises within Electronic Arts. Our group develops AI and data driven solutions to game team

problems. From data modeling to agent building, we utilize a modern, cloud-based tech stack with bestin-

class tools to provide solutions and platforms empowering the future state of game development,

marketing, sales, and player experience.

ML Scientist

AI Scientist

NLP Scientist

Intelligent Systems Engineer

Whatâs in it for you? Glad you asked!

We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition

reimbursement, and 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it

takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a

culture that thrives on creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the âwork hard/play hardâ credo every

day.

Analyze and extract key insights from EAâs rich store of player and gameplay data using machine

learning techniques
Create scalable solutions for problems in the gaming domain
Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning applications like

recommendations and targeting
Work closely with game teams to identify target problems with impact
Work closely with the core development teams to deploy models seamlessly as part of production

systems
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model

development, model validation and model implementation
Research and implement novel machine learning algorithms for new business problems.

Track record of having developed novel machine learning algorithms, SIGKDD/ICML/NIPS

publications a plus

Strong problem solving ability

Experience with large scale distributed programming paradigms â experience with the Hadoop

stack (HDFS/MR/Pig/Hive) a plus
Experience with analytic tools such as Spark, R, SAS, Matlab or SPSS
Experience with SQL and MPP databases
Excellent written and verbal communication and skills

the EA ecosystem

production systems

agent solutions

related to the game genre

systems across the EA ecosystem

and in-game interactions

related to the game genre

systems

development, model validation and model implementation.

The Pharmacy Analytics Data Analyst will provide reporting, forecasting, and analytical support for the HPS Analytics Team. This role is responsible for analyzing the impact of formulary changes to drive decisions that are beneficial to Humana and its members. This role supports all lines of business.
Providing analytical support to Trade Relations
Provide data support by capturing appropriate elements (using SQL and/or SAS) for analysis to be used by other members of the team
Forecasting value of initiatives related to Trade Relationsâ opportunities
Performing deep-dive analysis and answer questions around metric variances.
Communicating high level summary results to business owners and leadership.
Developing and improving processes and documentation to support best practices.
Performing ad-hoc analysis on an as-needed basis.
Key Competencies
Accountability:
Meets established expectations and takes responsibility for achieving results; encourages others to do the same.
Builds Trust:
Consistently models and inspires high levels of integrity, lives up to commitments, and takes responsibility for the impact of one's actions.
Collaborates:
Engages others by gathering multiple views and being open to diverse perspectives, focusing on a shared purpose that puts Humana's overall success first.
Pursues Excellence:
Seeks out learning, strives to develop and expand personally, and continuously helps others upgrade their capability to contribute to Humana.

Qualifications
Role Essentials
Bachelorâs Degree in Business, Computer Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
Advanced technical ability in Excel.
Moderate to advanced technical abilities in SQL and/or SAS.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to manage relationships with customers.
Candidates should have the ability to work on multiple projects with occasionally tight deadlines.
Candidates should also possess the ability to take initiative, work independently, and exercise appropriate business judgment.
Role Desirables
Mastersâ degree in Analytics, Business, Computer Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
Health care industry experience.
Familiar with pharmacy benefit management processes or organizations.
Prior work history in a clinical, pharmacy, or related setting.
Experience manipulating large, complex data sets.
Additional Information

At Humana, we know your well-being is important to you, and itâs important to us too. Thatâs why weâre committed to making resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life. If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana.

jobtitle: Business Intelligence and Data Analyst (Analytics Analyst) Immuno Oncology
job_summary:
At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As a

Business Intelligence and Data Analyst (Analytics Analyst) Immuno Oncology

in

Gaithersburg MD

, you'll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients' lives. North American Commercial is the 'face' of

AstraZeneca and MedImmune to our many healthcare clients. They represent many of the most well recognized and respected products in the industry, and build strong relationships with healthcare professionals.

AstraZenecaâs vision in

Oncology

is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm, with the aim of bringing six new cancer medicines to patients between 2013 and 2020. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. As well as other tumor types, these are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies.

In a completely hands-on role, you will be primarily responsible for providing rapid data access and reporting to the Commercial Organization with expertise in manipulating, integrating & aggregating large complex data sets.

We are looking for someone who is a data specialist with a passion for data quality, automation and an ability to easily develop quick data pipelines from extraction to reporting. You will be deployed as part of the Business Insight & Analytics team and will report to an Insight Director within the Oncology therapeutic area. Further you will be aligned to an Advanced Analytics Manager within the team for onboarding to our systems, data education, learning best practices in data organization & professional development.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

You will be responsible for extracting, combining and aggregating transaction-level data sets from disparate sources and formats (both relational databases and flat files) into data cubes optimized for rapid access to key measures & metrics allowing for on demand deep-dive views of the business.

Develop & build fit-for-purpose custom data pipelines to support the cross-functional needs of Forecasting, Primary Research, Performance Assessment & Advanced Analytics initiatives extending to Marketing teams.

Perform ad-hoc data investigation & queries to address an immediate business question and report data via cross-tabs, pivot tables, charts, basic statistics, distributions & correlations. Also, automate reports and build interactive dashboards if certain ad-hoc requests are needed on a regular basis.

Support the development, distribution and maintenance of standard set of Brand Performance Reports and Dashboards using appropriate reporting, visualization and data automation tools.

Manage timely delivery of processed data and information for data-driven Marketing & Sales initiatives such as segmented custom target lists for Marketing Research, Multi-Channel Campaigns Sales Force Targeting and Resource allocation with inputs from the Advanced Analytics team.

Own regular evaluation of all data sources being leveraged to ensure integrity and quality of the data, actively maintaining data dictionaries & metadata definition.

Actively participate and influence continuous improvements to Companyâs Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence solutions with a strong motive for eliminating redundant manual data extraction and processing.
Essential Requirements:
Bachelorâs Degree required; preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics or relevant Quantitative field. Advanced degree is a plus.

3+ years of experience in a data-rich environment; preferably using SQL/SAS for data extraction, processing, manipulation, query & reporting with a demonstrated practical knowledge of building analytical databases and management. Proficiency in SQL & SAS will be tested during the interviews.

2+ years of preferred experience in the Pharmaceutical / Biotech / Healthcare industry. Specifically, proficiency in manipulating and extracting insights from large longitudinal data sources, such as Medical/Pharmacy Claims, EMR and other patient level data sets.

Experience in building clean and simple automated reports in Excel and PowerPoint.

Experience in data modeling and developing dashboards/reports in QlikSense or MicroStrategy. Similar experience with other BI tools is strongly preferred

Experience with data warehousing (e.g. storage methods/formats, database design) preferred

Knowledge of Python and big data technology - Hadoop ecosystem (Cloudera distribution - Impala, Hive, Pig, Hbase, Spark, MapReduce etc.)

Next Steps -- Apply today!

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description

JP Morgan Chase
JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at

http://www.jpmorganchase.com/

.

Our Firmwide Risk Function

Our Firmwide Risk function is focused on cultivating a stronger, unified culture that embraces a sense of personal accountability for developing the highest corporate standards in governance and controls across the firm. Business priorities are built around the need to strengthen and guard the firm from the many risks we face, financial rigor, risk discipline, fostering a transparent culture and doing the right thing in every situation. We are equally focused on nurturing talent, respecting the diverse experiences that our team of Risk professionals bring and embracing an inclusive environment.

CCB Risk

Chase Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) serves consumers and small businesses with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, small business banking and lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice.

Consumer & Community Banking Risk Management partners with each CCB sub-line of business to identify, assess, prioritize and remediate risk.

Types of risk that occur in consumer businesses include fraud, reputation, operational, credit, market and regulatory, among others.

This position is part of the CCB Risk Analytics organization within Consumer & Community Banking Risk Management. Our mission is to make better customer-level risk decisions through the use of data from across all of the Retail and Wholesale customer bases within the Consumer & Community Bank and the Commercial Bank

Description

Senior Consumer Risk Data Analysts on the Data Infrastructure & Engineering team are responsible for identifying relevant data elements, running analysis to transform and enrich the data, and constructing optimally designed data products to be used in analysis and/or operational risk decisions. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate must have a solid understanding of CCB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of customer data.

The candidate must have the ability to partner with stakeholders inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust analytical data solutions that meet and/or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.

A strong desire to learn how performance is measured across the various businesses we support

Experience working in large-scale corporate data environments resolving inconsistencies and challenges in the data

Excellent presentation and facilitation skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Expert knowledge of the business lending lifecycle

Ability to lead and persuade others while positively influencing the outcome of team efforts

Powerful communicator who engages colleagues, business partners, external stakeholders, and employees.

Be known for providing creative thought leadership while also listening and engaging others to provide input in the shaping of that vision

Strong knowledge of the related regulatory environments

Knowledge of Chase IT tools such as ITSM and DM are a plus

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of usâand we're just getting started. Weâre looking for data scientists to work on our core and business products (Instagram, Ads, Messaging, Identity, Growth & Engagement, Mobile, Search, Privacy, Payments) with a passion for Internet technology to help drive informed business decisions for Facebook. You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. Exploratory Analysis
Proposing what to build in the next roadmap
Understanding ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends

Building models of user behaviors for analysis or to power production systems
Product Leadership

Spreading best practices to analytics and product teams
Data Infrastructure
Working in Hadoop and Hive primarily, sometimes MySQL, Oracle, and Vertica
Automating analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and python based ETL framework As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

jobtitle: Business Intelligence and Data Analyst (Analytics Analyst) Womens Oncology
job_summary:
At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As a

Business Intelligence and Data Analyst (Analytics Analyst) Womenâs Oncology

in

Gaithersburg MD

, you'll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients' lives. North American Commercial is the 'face' of

AstraZeneca and MedImmune to our many healthcare clients. They represent many of the most well recognized and respected products in the industry, and build strong relationships with healthcare professionals.

AstraZenecaâs vision in

Oncology

is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm, with the aim of bringing six new cancer medicines to patients between 2013 and 2020. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. As well as other tumor types, these are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies.

In a completely hands-on role, you will be primarily responsible for providing rapid data access and reporting to the Commercial Organization with expertise in manipulating, integrating & aggregating large complex data sets.

We are looking for someone who is a data specialist with a passion for data quality, automation and an ability to easily develop quick data pipelines from extraction to reporting. You will be deployed as part of the Business Insight & Analytics team and will report to an Insight Director within the Oncology therapeutic area. Further you will be aligned to an Advanced Analytics Manager within the team for onboarding to our systems, data education, learning best practices in data organization & professional development.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

You will be responsible for extracting, combining and aggregating transaction-level data sets from disparate sources and formats (both relational databases and flat files) into data cubes optimized for rapid access to key measures & metrics allowing for on demand deep-dive views of the business.

Develop & build fit-for-purpose custom data pipelines to support the cross-functional needs of Forecasting, Primary Research, Performance Assessment & Advanced Analytics initiatives extending to Marketing teams.

Perform ad-hoc data investigation & queries to address an immediate business question and report data via cross-tabs, pivot tables, charts, basic statistics, distributions & correlations. Also, automate reports and build interactive dashboards if certain ad-hoc requests are needed on a regular basis.

Support the development, distribution and maintenance of standard set of Brand Performance Reports and Dashboards using appropriate reporting, visualization and data automation tools.

Manage timely delivery of processed data and information for data-driven Marketing & Sales initiatives such as segmented custom target lists for Marketing Research, Multi-Channel Campaigns Sales Force Targeting and Resource allocation with inputs from the Advanced Analytics team.

Own regular evaluation of all data sources being leveraged to ensure integrity and quality of the data, actively maintaining data dictionaries & metadata definition.

Actively participate and influence continuous improvements to Companyâs Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence solutions with a strong motive for eliminating redundant manual data extraction and processing.
Essential Requirements:
Bachelorâs Degree required; preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics or relevant Quantitative field. Advanced degree is a plus.

3+ years of experience in a data-rich environment; preferably using SQL/SAS for data extraction, processing, manipulation, query & reporting with a demonstrated practical knowledge of building analytical databases and management. Proficiency in SQL & SAS will be tested during the interviews.

2+ years of preferred experience in the Pharmaceutical / Biotech / Healthcare industry. Specifically, proficiency in manipulating and extracting insights from large longitudinal data sources, such as Medical/Pharmacy Claims, EMR and other patient level data sets.

Experience in building clean and simple automated reports in Excel and PowerPoint.

Experience in data modeling and developing dashboards/reports in QlikSense or MicroStrategy. Similar experience with other BI tools is strongly preferred

Experience with data warehousing (e.g. storage methods/formats, database design) preferred

Knowledge of Python and big data technology - Hadoop ecosystem (Cloudera distribution - Impala, Hive, Pig, Hbase, Spark, MapReduce etc.)

Next Steps -- Apply today!

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.

Propel Health was established by seven Oregon health systems and one of Oregon's largest medical insurance providers. Propel Health provides the tools, technology and partnerships that will enable owner organizations to offer population health management best practices to health care purchasers across the state. We are investing in state-of-the-art technology to aggregate health information from a variety of sources to identify risk factors, deploy evidence-based best practices, and coordinate care with patients, families and their caregivers. This approach to healthcare delivery has demonstrated increases in quality and substantial savings to the purchaser and Propel is bringing this new approach to Oregon.
Mission: To deliver the tools, methods and support necessary for optimal health management in the communities we serve.
Attributes: Curious Explorer â¢ Driven to Serve â¢ Enthusiastically Collaborative
Competencies: Developing reports and data analysis â¢ Transforming data into informational and actionable insight
Promise: To enable integrated care delivery to support clinicians in improving health outcomes.
Job Summary

The Healthcare Data Analyst is responsible for advancing the mission of Propel Health through proactively identifying opportunities to leverage data into actionable information in support of Propel Health and its partners. S/he will scrutinize, explore, and summarize data findings under the direction of the Healthcare Reporting and Analytics Manager. The Healthcare Data Analyst will interface directly with vendors and partners and provide regular and ad-hoc reporting and analysis. S/he will work closely with cross-functional teams and report on and analyze clinical, financial, and operational data.
Accountabilities
Work with internal and external stakeholders to proactively identify opportunities to leverage data into actionable information.
Analyze clinical program operations to determine how to measure and report on key operational, performance and quality metrics.
Translate moderately complex and varied clinical operation processes into reporting and data requirements and support documentation of analytic specifications.
Collaborate with Vendor analytics, IT development and data warehouse teams to inform and validate reporting requirements.
Communicate effectively with all stakeholders to ensure clarity of business needs and their translation into analytic requirements.
Take a systematic and replicable process to data investigation and analysis
Perform ad hoc healthcare data analysis and own the creation of reports using MicroStrategy or similar business intelligence tool.
Assist in the development of a training plan, training materials, and initiation of training for the end user training on reports.
Create and maintain regular reports for distribution across partnership. Execute regular reviews and quality checks of reports to ensure highest quality output.
Present data and explain analysis to internal and external stakeholders; lead meetings and interface with vendors as requested.
Qualifications
Bachelorâs degree with either a quantitative major (actuarial, statistics, economics, engineering, computer science, applied math) or healthcare major (health administration, public health) is required.
Minimum 2 years of experience performing data analysis and demonstrated technical proficiency with data manipulation and analysis in Access, Excel, and other business intelligence tools (MicroStrategy preferred).
Strong written and verbal communication skills and discipline to multitask and prioritize projects to meet scheduled deadlines
Professionally interact with diverse group of stakeholders including executives, managers, clients, vendors and subject matter experts.
Problem solver, resourceful, quick learner
Works effectively and collaboratively across a high performing team of functional experts, program managers, and data analysts
Healthcare data experience preferred.
Knowledge of claims, utilization, and clinical quality measurement preferred.

Our salaries are competitive and commensurate with experience. We are a performance-based culture and have generous employee benefits that take care of our employees and their families such as fully paid maternity and parental leave and flexible work arrangements. Our comprehensive benefits package includes medical, dental, vision insurance and life, AD&D, short and long term disability insurance. We offer a retirement plan with company match up to 4% and immediate vesting, four weeks of PTO, 9 holidays, wellness policy and transit subsidy. Our office is located in the heart of downtown Portland, Oregon, close to Pioneer Square, Food Carts and TriMet bus and MAX stops.
Propel Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, religion, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or physical or mental disability.

Data Scientist (Product)

We are looking for Data Scientist to join the band and help drive a data-first culture across Spotify.

As Data Scientist, our mission is to turn terabytes of data into insights and get a deep understanding of how our people use our apps to impact the product, strategy and direction of Spotify. You will study user behavior, strategic initiatives, content, and new features and bring data and insights into every decision we make. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.
What youâll do:
Perform analyses on large sets of data to extract actionable insights that will help drive product decisions
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, user researchers, product owners, designers, and engineers who are passionate about Spotifyâs success
Work from our offices in New York
Conduct A/B testing to drive iterative improvement through efficient experimentation
Who you are:
You have at least 4+years of experience in a similar data scientist and a degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline.
You have a deep understanding of numbers, as well as a strong business sense.
Ideally you have experience working in a product analytics or insights role and have conducted A/B tests
You have the technical competence to perform more advanced analytics:
Coding skills for analytics and data extraction (SQL, R, Python, Pandas)
Data visualization (such as Tableau, Qlik, D3, ggplot)
Experience performing analysis with large datasets
You are capable of tackling very loosely defined problems.
You are a communicative person that values building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders and have the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world listens to music.

With a range of products and services enhancing how you live, play and work, weâre keeping you connected to the future. We rely on the latest in data science and engineering to curate, analyze and improve our customer experience and operations.

With massive scale comes massive opportunity.
