The data analyst will conduct full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Develops analysis and reporting capabilities. Monitors performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Main Job Functions

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and databases/data systems

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

Filter and âcleanâ data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems in MOSAIQ

Work with management to prioritize business and information needs

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Supervisory Responsibilities

None

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Ability to project a professional image.

Demonstrates critical thinking skills. Thinks independently, professionally, and ethically.

Knowledge of regulatory standards and compliance requirements in addition to departmental policies and procedures.

Working knowledge and ability to apply professional standards of practice in job situations.

Strong organizational and analytical skills.

Maintain appropriate professional composure in high stress situations.

Working knowledge of personal computer and software applications used in job functions.

Persons who have been found guilty by a court of law of abusing, neglecting, or mistreating individuals in a health care related setting are ineligible for employment in this position.

Freedom from illegal use of drugs.

Freedom from use of and effects of use of drugs and alcohol in the workplace.

Education and/or Experience

BA or BS in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.

Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst

Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc)

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel etc)

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Adapt at queries, and presenting findings

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

None required

What We Offer

Competitive Salary

401(k) + Employer Match

Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance

Short and Long Term Disability, Life Insurance

Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays

Employee Assistance Program

Austin Cancer Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The Data Analyst is responsible for the statistical support of population health and clinical research involving multidisciplinary teams . This position applies biostatistical skills to the analysis and interpretation of studies pertaining to health disparities, injuries, behavioral health, chronic diseases, infectious diseases, and reproductive and perinatal health.
Typical Duties:
1. Assists with the identification of analytic approaches for population health and clinical research in collaboration with research team.
2. Prepares and updates documentation (e.g. guides, codebooks, and data dictionaries) for multiple databases.
3. Implements quality control procedures to ensure data integrity.
4. Prepares data for analysis (i.e. validation, recoding, etc.).
5. Implements statistical analysis plan and generates results.
6. Assists with preparing detailed descriptions of analyses and findings for funding proposals, manuscripts, and abstracts through consultation with team members.
7. Actively seeks new knowledge of methods for data management and analysis.
8. Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
Required Education and Experience:Master's degree in biostatistics, statistics, or other quantitative discipline from an accredited college or university.
2 plus years of experience with at least one statistical software package (e.g. Stata, R, or SAS).
Preferred Education and Experience:1 plus years of experience in health research.

The 3P Softlines team is looking for a passionate and solution-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to run analytical solutions that deepen our collective understanding of customers, influence innovation, and deliver actionable insights for our Softlines 3P seller business (Clothing, Shoes, Jewelry, Luggage and Watches) in the US. The Softlines business is one of the fastest-growing categories on Amazonâs marketplace, with selection spanning top fashion brands and main street retailers, ethnic and workwear, independent designers and low-priced imports and basics. Marketplace caters for all tastes and needs, and the selection is vast and still growing.

The ideal candidate has outstanding business acumen, a restlessness to answer âwhy?â questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, superior written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams. You will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and will enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. In this role you will also be a thought leader with the 3P Softlines Sales and Product team in North America.
Background on the Amazon Marketplace: The Marketplace or âSelling on Amazonâ business exceeds 40% of the total Amazon.com sales and growing. Each year, tens of thousands of businesses join the marketplace adding millions of new products. Amazon also sells a suite of other services to ecommerce companies such as Amazon Payments, eCommerce Web Hosting, and Product Advertising. Together with the Marketplace these services create a compelling offering for sellers.
The ideal candidate will:
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help shape the customer engagement, sales and marketing roadmap.
Develop a thorough understanding of customer behavior, competitive product trends, and business drivers to inform decision making.
Analyze key insight trends and build models that predict customer behavior, using statistical rigor to simplify and provide thought leadership to NA Marketplace.
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop and maintain customer segmentation.
Build automated dashboards and reporting to enable the business development teams to self-service account-level insights that drive toward their goals.
Collaborate with NA Marketplace Finance and Product Management as a leader of ongoing analytical support for 3P Softlines initiatives.
Generate Impact: We want someone obsessed with impact, who understands how to turn insights into value every day.

Basic Qualifications

Excellent SQL/ETL skills
5+ years of professional experience in CRM, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics position
Top notch written and verbal communication skills to convey key insights from complex analysis in summarized business terms
Expertise with MS Excel, SQL, SAS or R

Preferred Qualifications

E-commerce experience a plus
Demonstrated experience delivering actionable insight for a consumer business
Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy
Experience in designing and implementing custom targeting optimization systems and working with technical teams
Experience in deploying machine learning, statistics and/or econometrics in a production setting

Responsible for ongoing analysis and reporting of operational and financial information in support of both the PBM and ABM
products for internal and external customers. Perform Ad-Hoc analysis and investigations to answer a question, support decision
making, and/or reveal new opportunities. This is to be accomplished by means of data analysis in conjunction with acquiring and applying knowledge of the business and systems processes necessary to interpret and produce reliable and valid conclusions from the
data.

Key Responsibilities - To simplify complexities for each customer :

Create reports to fulfill user requests based on queries ranging from rudimentary to highly sophisticated:
Data Extracts â Create and supply a data set appropriate to the userâs targeted analysis to allow the user to perform a self-analysis.
Ad-Hoc Reporting
i. Creating a unique one-time report from well-defined user specifications.
ii. Creating a variation of an existing system report to provide additional information. (Examples would include be not be limited to the application of additional filters, unique calculations, alternative aggregations, etc.)
Prototyping â Creating a report to fulfill a user requested idea where the specification is largely unclear and will likely require a significant exploration of the data and numerous iterations of the report before the customer needs are met and can then be coded into a production report.
Gain a detailed understanding of the Data Analysis Request by exploring the business need for each Request.
Learning from the requestor the business purpose of the request.
Learn about the business processes that shape the data to be used in the fulfillment of the request.
Validate approach suggestions given by the requestor to ensure they align appropriately with the objectives of the project.
Use subject matter expertise to guide the requester to better ways of solving the need.
Reach a consensus with the requester of the approach to be used to fulfill the request ensuring the objectives are met.
Prepares data for analysis by inspecting, cleansing, and transforming data and evaluates results by interrogating the data to find and understand anomalies and / or outliers.
Review reporting/analytic outputs and provide insights and recommendations
Collaborates with members of the department, SMEâs, and internal customers in ongoing decisions regarding study design, data collection, data analysis and methodology.
Additional Responsibilities:Strategic Initiatives: Actively engages in driving strategic initiatives, and the related goals, to ensure the most optimal outcome.
Communication: Effectively communicates using written, oral, non-verbal, and active listening skills. Has the ability to clearly present an idea or concept so others understand, lets others speak, and engages productively in difficult conversations while upholding our ethical values.
Position Qualifications :Qualifications/Education/Certifications:
Bachelorâs degree preferably in business, economics, statistics or a math-related subject; plus a minimum of two to four years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Must possess analytical skills to evaluate, understand and interpret data from both internal and client perspective
Must be able to communicate ideas and analysis results effectively both verbally and in writing to both a technical and non-technical audience
A proven track record for executing complex data extraction and analytical projects
Must possess statistical analysis and graphical data display
3+ years of SQL experience writing complex queries and table joins
3+ yearsâ experience with T/SQL
Proficiency with MS Excel and MS Word
Visio preferred
Experience with Object Oriented Code a plus.
Must demonstrate a superior ability to recognize and define problems, understand business and system processes, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Must be able to formulate and communicate questions to gather the necessary missing information to resolve a problem.
Solid organizational skills and focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities
Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Core Competencies:
Action Orientation
Customer Engagement
Flexibility
Interpersonal Effectiveness
Character
Results Focus
Collaboration
Self-Management
Communication
Physical Demands/Working Conditions:
Duties are performed primarily in an office setting. Travel to attend meetings and visit locations throughout the country may be required. Operates computer and standard office equipment, such as telephone and copier/printer.

Company Overview:
Netsmart is healthcareâs largest human services and integrated care technology provider. Netsmart technology platforms and expertise are integral to the delivery of outcomes-based services and care to more than 25 million persons nationwide. Netsmart serves more than 500,000 users in more than 24,000 organizations across all 50 states. Netsmart client communities include behavioral health, addiction treatment, intellectual and developmental disabilities, child and family services, public health, home health, hospice and palliative care, private duty and vital records.
We became the industry leader through the creation of cutting edge software solutions to meet our clientâs needs. This level of creation and product evolution is only made possible by assembling a team of the best and the brightest technical talent in the industry. Do you have what it takes to join us on this journey?
Position Overview:
This position will support the automation and continued advancement of the Netsmart Revenue Cycle Management team. The Data Analyst will work under the direction of Business Analysts to support report building, data transfer, manipulation to prepare data for other systems, and automation of reports to support efficiencies and billing support. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented and have a passion to grow their skillsets in data, analytics, and technical systems and reporting.
Responsibilities:
Extract, manipulate, analyze and integrate large sets of data across multiple master data sources e.g. Client billing systems (i.e. Avatar, Evolv, Tier, etc), RevConnect, Excel.
Integrate data into corresponding reporting formats for billing operations
Work under direction of more Sr Business Analyst to build and support automated eligibility and billing reports.
Support and maintain reporting tools within the as necessary.
Team player with experience working with cross functional teams to understand metrics and data
Deliver high quality data and reports on time and with limited to no errors
Provide creative solutions to new data requests and further the understanding and use of current data models.
Participate in regular operational meetings with a focus on both tactical and strategic action items
Qualifications:
Demonstrated experience with Excel, to include intermediate skills such as pivot tables, v-lookup, and data download and upload formats
Experienced in data manipulation, data mining, extraction and reporting
Experienced in querying and reporting off of SQL databases or Crystal Reports skills a plus
Familiarity with medical billing or billing processes a plus
Demonstrated ability to follow up on action items assigned to self and others in a timely manner
High School diploma required
Technical or Certificate program completion (2 years) or equivalent experience in technology, reporting, or business office environment
Bachelorâs Degree in relevant Technical field preferred

In Addition to a Competitive Salary, Successful Candidates Will Receive:
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance available Day 1
Life Insurance
Short/Long Term Disability
401(k) Plan/EAP

jobtitle: Senior Analyst, Global Business Insights and Analytics
job_summary:
NetJets Inc., a Berkshire Hathaway company, is the worldwide leader in private aviation and manages and operates the largest and most diverse private jet fleet in the world. NetJets began in 1964 as the first aircraft charter company. In 1986, NetJets pioneered the concept of fractional aircraft ownership -- offering individuals and businesses all the benefits of whole aircraft ownership at a fraction of the cost.

Today, NetJets offers a full range of private aviation solutions to satisfy almost every travel need, including the NetJets ShareTM, the NetJets LeaseTM, the Marquis Jet CardÂ®, and the NetJets Europe Private Jet Card, as well as aircraft management and on-demand charter services through its subsidiary, Executive Jet ManagementÂ® and Executive Jet Management Europe. With operations in the United States and Europe, NetJets' reach is truly global

**Come work for THE leader and private aviation and have the opportunity for a SIGN ON BONUS!!**

Responsible to provide timely, relevant and accurate analysis of operational and business data inclusive of NetJets North America, NetJets Europe, NetJets China and Executive Jet Management. Perform business and operational analysis to impact global business results and support Senior Management (C-suite) decision making. Individual is expected to investigate and understand diverse areas of the business and operation (e.g. maintenance, sales, flight operations, aircraft management, labor relations), support Executive leadership initiatives and communicate findings effectively. Analyst expected to work under general supervision and provide leadership and direction on complex and diverse projects.
MAJOR DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:60%: Performs analysis of both strategic and tactical business and operational questions working independently with reliance on creative analytical curiosity. Analysis of data involves highly complex business and operational opportunities. Consultatively collaborates with business partners (e.g. IT, FP&A, crew resource planning) to analytically explore business and operational problems, develop reports, track and understand operational issues. Develops reports and creates presentations for Executive leadership exploring business and operational opportunities and recommends solutions.
20%: Collaborate with, mentor, develop and support other analysts
20%: Lead special analytical projects preparing detailed and comprehensive presentations supporting corporate initiatives.
Required Qualifications:Education Level: Bachelor's Degree
Course of Study/Major: Applied Math, Economics, Statistics or other quantitative field
Related Work Experience: 4-6 years
Additional Requirements:Strong verbal and written presentation skills
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to understand and master new concepts quickly
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate to all levels of employees and management.
Exceptional creative problem solving abilities
Must be detail oriented with a proven ability to prioritize multiple objectives in a dynamic environment with constantly shifting priorities.
Initiative, drive, and confidence to achieve results without explicit direction or detailed instructions
Experience with SQL, Excel, SAS and/or other business intelligence and analytics software
Interest and familiarity with aviation preferred
Desirable Qualifications:Educational Level: Master's Degree
Course of Study/Major: MBA or MS in Analytics, Operations Research or similar discipline preferred
Work Experience: 6-8 years
Experience using query tools such as Hyperion/Brio Intelligence, Business Objects, Microsoft Access or experience using SQL to extract information from databases
Experience with report writing software
Use of Hadoop, Pig, Hive or other "Big Data" software
Knowledge of machine learning tools
Interest and familiarity with aviation Â· Familiarity with NetJets core competencies including, but not limited to, flight scheduling, crew scheduling, crew planning, maintenance planning & execution, sales, and owner service.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

jobtitle: MSLA: Provider Network Supervisor, Tampa, FL
job_summary:
MSLA is a Medical Corporation that provides comprehensive independent medical evaluations (IME) and other IME related services to the government and private industry. Our business philosophy incorporates both exceptional customer service and quality evaluations, both of which are the primary factors for our rapid growth since our inception in 1998. No industry is moving faster than health care. And no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward. We need attention to every detail with an eye for the points no one has considered. The rewards for performance are significant. You'll help improve the health of millions. And you'll do your life's best work.(sm) Primary Responsibilities:
Support oversight of provider network staff and functions
Sets priorities for the team to ensure task completion
Coordinate work activities with other supervisors
Identify and resolve operational problems using defined processes, expertise and judgment
Make decisions that are guided by policies, procedures and business plan
Analyze geographical territories against customer needs and establish departmental plans to address network adequacy
Ensure the network composition includes appropriate distribution of provider specialties
Assists department staff with questions
Evaluate and negotiate complex contracts within business parameters to include contract templates and reimbursement structure standards
Establish and maintain strong business relationships with key network providers
Performs quality review of department work to ensure department meets company quality standards
Assists management with new team member training
Collects performance data and generates reports for both individual and team performance
Encourages team members and assists with remedial training
All other duties assigned by Management
Required Qualifications:
Bachelorâs degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience
4+ years of experience with healthcare provider network recruitment and contracting
3+ years of leadership experience
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Basic proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
1+ year of analytics experience (performance, claims, network adequacy, and / or outcomes data)
Ability to travel overnight, approximately on a quarterly basis
High level of discretion to work with confidential information
Able to follow routine procedures consistently and efficiently
Able to work independently, and in conjunction with team members at all levels of the organization
Able to understand instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Detail - oriented

The Opportunity:
Shutterstock is growing by leaps and bounds and our data is too. We are looking for an ambitious data analyst with eCommerce and A/B testing experience who understand metrics and our business, in order to support and optimize our rapid business growth. Great candidates will be able to understand the big picture needs of a publicly traded international eCommerce business and deliver information with speed, accuracy and clarity. You will be working with highly motivated and talented analysts, marketers, product managers, UX designer, and engineers to generate actionable insight and analytics to empower data-driven decisions.

About Shutterstock
Shutterstock, Inc. (NYSE: SSTK), is a leading global provider of high-quality licensed photographs, vectors, illustrations, videos and music to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world.

Working with its growing community of over 100,000 contributors, Shutterstock adds hundreds of thousands of images each week, and currently has more than 80 million images and nearly 4 million video clips available.

Headquartered in New York City, with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, London, Los Angeles, Montreal, Paris, SanFrancisco, and Silicon Valley, Shutterstock has customers in more than 150 countries. The company also owns Bigstock, a value-oriented stock media agency; Offset, a high-end image collection; PremiumBeat a curated royalty-free music library; Rex Features, a premier source of editorial images for the world's media; and WebDAM, a cloud-based digital asset management service for businesses.

For more information, please visit www.shutterstock.com ( http://www.shutterstock.com/ ) and follow Shutterstock on Twitter ( https://twitter.com/shutterstock )and on Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/Shutterstock/ ).

job_summary:

Job Description: Responsible for turning data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions, the Senior Health Care Data Analyst will conduct full lifecycle analytical activities to include requirements analysis and design, development of data analysis, reporting, visualization enhancement, continuous monitoring of performance and quality control plans to identify opportunities. The Senior Health Care Data Analyst is responsible for the configuration and administration of analytic tools, the development and use of databases, data marts, reports, dashboards and the interpretation of data and analysis results using statistical techniques. Also responsible for profiling, filtering and cleansing data and applying quality control techniques to reports, outcomes and performance indicators to locate and correct coding problems. Six (6) years of progressive experience in Analytic and Informatics Services. Technical expertise regarding data models, relational database design, data visualization tools and dashboard design. Strong knowledge of and practical experience with reporting packages and databases (SQL/TSQL and SQL Server Management Studios) as well as Clinical Analytics (Medical Expense Budget Analysis, Clinical Initiative Analysis, etc). Strong analytic skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Must have the ability to analyze and solve data management problems and analyze; interpret clinical data. Basic knowledge of scripting languages (Python, VB, Powershell, etc.) is also preferred. Proficient with business intelligence solutions (data warehouses, data marts, dashboards and scorecards) using Microsoft, Tableau or other prominent BI technology tools preferred. jobtitle: Executive Director, Strategic Analytics, Data, and Effectiveness - PSS
job_summary:
The Analytics, Data, and Effectiveness lead will set the strategic direction for an insights-driven analytics and research team that proactively helps drive performance and shape the future of Novartis Pharma and our Patient and Specialty Services organization.

In partnership with Franchise Heads, Patient Access Team and PSS Leadership, this individual will take a leading role in shaping strategy and operational management of data management (internal and external) and analytics to support effective data review and visualization across the Novartis Pharma portfolio. Through this strategic under-standing and thought leadership, this individual will define the key business questions and challenges facing our business that are critical to achieving business objectives. Translation of these questions/challenges into actionable insights and analytics initiatives is essential enable the development of recommendations and solutions so that business and brand strategies can be developed to meet performance expectations. Coordinates process improvement initiatives within and across PSS, establishing and tracking performance metrics. Many of the PSS programs are executed via external parties and we have a variety of data feeds/sources/inputs, the role of this person is to collectively work with our PSS program leads and the franchise commercial leadership to track performance, analyze effectiveness, model impact of changes, and drive the reporting and analytical agenda for the group.

This individual will be the Analytics/Data/Effectiveness expert for PSS, providing problem solving leadership to enable analytic-based solutions to business questions and challenges. This individual is recognized as an expert within the organization analytics/tracking/effectiveness of many of the US Pharma HUB Operations and tracking, Data Management Strategy, Dashboards (Brand/Franchise/Field), Program/Performance tracking/effectiveness and reporting across all programs (co-pay, adherence, hub operations, scenario planning etc..) She/he is able to provide problem solving leadership to enable analytic-based solutions to business questions and challenges in situations requiring new/innovative approaches. This person will guide a team of Analytics associates who work with US Pharma and with brand teams/other analysts to address business questions to help shape channel/customer contracts, design and refine patient service programs, shape our interactions with specialty pharmacies, build strategies, and maximize patient impact and financial return for our program spend. The team will be generating, analyzing and synthesizing data & insights for our brands and customers/channels is critical to the development of brand and customer strategies and to driving business performance.

Major Activities
Provide leadership for US Pharma: Become the key problem solving partner to the relevant stakeholders by establishing strong relationships with key business leaders and partnering with them in understanding their unique business challenges and priority data and analytical/reporting elements. Translate the business needs into actionable analytic-focused initiatives to provide solutions and/or recommendations to enable the business excellence.
Provide leadership for US Pharma: Recognized as expert in the field of Analytics/Tracking/Effectiveness (patient and specialty services a plus) as evidenced by establishing strong relationships with key business leaders and partnering with them in understanding their unique business challenges. Translate the business needs into actionable analytic-focused initiatives to provide solutions and/or recommendations to enable the business excellence.

Coach, guide and manage all team members and franchise/functional work streams: Ensure operations team focuses on critical business questions, drives towards strategic and synthesized insights, and suggests ideas and recommendations that enable better decision-making for the business.
Strategic thinking and leadership: Shape a vision, goals and priorities for Analytics/Data/Effectiveness team. Lead or shape strategic reviews/âdeep-divesâ for Stakeholders and Influence business.
Functional Responsibilities: Deliver insightful and actionable related insights and analytics for the US Pharma organization. Manage department budgets, resources. Drive efficiency. Drive performance orientation.

Maintain full compliance with internal and external guidelines

EEO Statement

The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Minimum requirements

Fluent English (Oral and Written)

Bachelorâs Degree required (Business, Statistics/Operations Research/Mathematics, Market Research)

MBA preferred; Advanced degree, preferably in Business, Analytics, and /or life sciences

Experience in leading and delivery advanced analytics, reporting, and data mgmt functions, with specific emphasis on specialty pharmacy data sets and patients services preferred

Experience in Brand Marketing and/or other Business areas a plus (e.g., Managed Markets, Sales, Sales Ops)

Minimum 10 years of overall pharmaceutical/biotech industry experience, majority in the US, including specialty pharma experience (injected, infused, biologics and/or institutional products)

Minimum 5 years in managed markets/heathcare marketing and/or marketing research and/or analytics or related experience involving: framing of strategic questions to be solved, generating insights (primary research or secondary analytics), data management, synthesizing implications, driving for practical/actionable solutions, measuring impact

Minimum 5 years doing analytics in pharma

Strong expertise in communication and information/data management

Cross-functional experience preferred (e.g., managed markets, pricing, medical, analytics, sales, marketing)

Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to translate a complex reports and analysis easy to understand presentations; proven ability to effectively present results to internal clients up to the executive level

Business Acumen - ability to link multiple insights across brands and channels to generate insights, prioritize business questions and develop effective recommendations
Learning agility: ability to pick up new trends and learn quickly

Demonstrated partnering and influencing skills, stakeholder management, project management, people management

Proven ability to lead and drive performance of a team

Solid understanding of research methods, experimental design (quantitative and qualitative) and specialty pharma, hospital data sources

Solid understanding of analytics, databases in the pharma industry

Strategic thinking and planning

Business and technical problem solving

Ability to align initiatives with strategic goals and communicate recommendations from a perspective of enhancing enterprise value

The City of Portland is seeking a Management Analyst in the Portland Bureau of Transportation (PBOT). The position is located within the Strategy, Innovation, and Performance division. Data Science - All Levels
About You: Ambitious, articulate and creative quant-geek. Loves analyzing big, messy data to uncover key business insights, and has the technical chops to extract data. Communicates findings simply, but no simpler. You pride yourself on not only being able to bring the right tools and methods to bear on problems, but to learn or even create new tools and methods when the need arises. However, at the end of the day, you care most about making a difference.
Keywords relevant to you:
Analytics, Big Data, Business Intelligence, Data Mining, Experimental Design, Predictive Modeling
Claims Data, Electronic Medical Records, Outcomes Research, Healthcare Economics and Policy, Health Information Technology, Healthcare Reform, Marketing
Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science
About Us: athenahealth is a pioneering company in electronic medical records and health practice management; all under a single-instance, cloud-based, software-enabled services platform. And culture is our greatest asset: energetic, forward thinking and supportive. On top of this culture, we are building the first national health information backbone to improve healthcare delivery and develop new healthcare applications.
About the Position: As a member of this unique team, you will combine problem-solving, data-analysis, and technical skills to identify, quantify, and solve real-world healthcare workflow problems. You will develop expert-level knowledge of how athenahealthâs billing and EMR software functionâand use this knowledge to deliver prescriptive, actionable solutions to stakeholders across the company. You will work with a rapidly growing team that is constantly challenging the boundaries of what is possible. You will directly contribute to improved financial and clinical workflow performance for providers, allowing them to focus on the business of delivering healthcare.
Responsibilities:
Lead analysis into key performance metrics. Discover â and then quantify â drivers and levers through collaboration with internal teams and your own data analysis
Translate your findings into what is relevant at a business level, and present to internal or external stakeholders. Your analysis will help athena make important decisions about product innovations, and will help providers optimize their business by using our products effectively
Strong willingness and aptitude for learning new concepts and analytical approaches
Collaborate in the development of complex analytic, statistical and methodological issues
Engineer solutions from automated discovery to an expert diagnostic system which combines our knowledge teamsâ unrivaled capabilities with technology and embedded analytics
Become an expert on athenahealthâs business processes and data structures
Develop a âtrusted advisorâ reputation across athenahealth
Qualifications:
Experience working with datasets, and strong interest in deep data analysis â you need to be a detective at heart.
Experience in at least one programming language (such as Perl, python, C/C++, java) or data extraction language (SQL) or higher level language (such as R, SAS).
Bachelorâs degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or other quantitative field, plus 2+ years of relevant experience; or Masterâs/PhD/ScD in a quantitative field. You may be a software engineer, or you might be doing this type of work off the side of your desk (or even at home).
Ability to formulate hypotheses, draw conclusions and deliver results
Sense of humor and effective interpersonal communication skills
Healthcare experience is not required; you will learn from A-team colleagues!
Experience in applying quantitative analysis to business operations is a plus but not required

Matterport is shaking up 2D photos with 3D and VR immersive media content. Our team has developed an end-to-end platform that allows anyone to seamlessly create, edit, and share 3D and VR models of real-world spaces. Our products are already used by thousands of professionals in a variety of industries, including real estate, hospitality, and construction, resulting in tens of millions of users visiting spaces every month.

Whatâs this role all about? Matterport 3D and VR content offers users unparalleled immersive experiences (see https://matterport.com/gallery/) . Matterport wants to use in-product user behavior to understand customer behaviors better, make more data-driven business decisions, enrich its existing product experience, and launch new products.
Youâll join a small, newly formed Data Engineering team within a dynamic, growing startup. The team designs and builds a platform to store, move, and analyze data, as well as analytic applications for customers and partners.
Youâll also partner closely with product and engineering leadership to define customer-facing analytics, lay the foundation for data engineering internally, and collaborate to enable data driven decision-making throughout the companyâs business operations. What will you do?
Build a scalable data engineering architecture and infrastructure (such as ETLs, data exchange processes with 3rd parties, A/B testing, reliability systems etc.)
Continually acquire new data sources to develop an increasingly rich dataset that characterizes the business - from space metadata to product usage to financial data. This dataset will be the foundation for many strategic uses cases from multiple teams
Create ready-to-share dashboards that reflect key business operations and product metrics
Collaborate with product to define internal and customer-facing analytics product roadmap
Build analytic applications that help space creators and managers efficiently make great content
Create software and social glue between engineers, scientists, product managers, sales, marketing, and other analytics teams
Explore and analyze data to decipher insights to inform operations and product decisions
Partner closely with the Product team to design and implement A/B tests, understand the data, iterate and deploy winning experiences in production Who are you?
You have coded extensively (5+ years) in at least one scripting language (such as Javascript and Python etc.)
You have a strong understanding of statistics. Explaining statistical concepts to engineers, analysts, non-technical team members is not problem for you
You are data driven; always testing, measuring and learning in your work
You are extremely collaborative and communicate clearly
You are a SQL expert
You are motivated to explore new technologies and learn, and can do so without taking formal education
You have experience scaling up data infrastructure -- user event logging, ETLs, reporting and visualization, and backend data management products (such as Mixpanel, Segment.io , Google Analytics, AWS Redshift and Airflow etc.)
You have experience working in an AWS environment (RDS, RedShift, S3)
You have experience with some big data tech (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Elasticsearch etc.)
You have a BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Economics or equivalent experience Nice to haves
You have a strong understanding of the concepts, terminology, and measurement issues related to Web Analytics both in terms of user behavior for product development and design as well as campaign attribution, ROI for traffic acquisition and retention efforts, and A/B testing
Experience with its data science libraries
Deep understanding of modern machine learning methods for regression and classification
You have first-hand experience building personalization and/or predictive products - recommendations and insight publications - using user data.

jobtitle: Business Intelligence and Analytics Senior Consultant
job_summary:

The Senior Business Intelligence and Analytics Consultant will provide evidence-based analytics, robust data solutions, and mission-critical communications management for our clients.

As a Senior Business Intelligence and Analytics Consultant, you will:

forecasting, and reporting

Required:

Company Overview

Description Job Summary:
Do you have a strong mathematics background and experience with statistical programming? If so, apply today to join the UPMC Health Plan as a Scientist.
The Scientist works independently using a robust math toolbox to discover solutions for a diverse portfolio of interesting and challenging problems. They build predictive models to help understand risk. They develop, implement, and monitor advanced analytic, medical informatics, and predictive modeling tools for health care programs at the UPMC Health Plan.
The Scientist normally works Monday through Friday, standard business hours or additional hours as needed by the department. This position is located in downtown Pittsburgh. Apply today if you are interested in being considered for this opportunity!
Responsibilities:Execution of all phases of quantitative research projects: identifying the business problem, data exploration, modeling, communication of final results.
Consults with and provides guidance on the selection and use of modeling software and programs.
Design, develop, and implement health care analytic and biomedical modeling programs.
Implements plans for capturing and creating new data elements, working with Health Plan CIO and IT staff.
Responsible for conceiving, planning, designing, developing and validating robust algorithms for use in analyzing health care models.

Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Bio-informatics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Decision Science, Health Services Research or related field is required.
Ph.D. is highly preferred.
Three or more years of experience in quantitative methods or other relevant work experience is required.
Strong mathematics and science background with sound analytical/computational skills and proficiency in pattern recognition and classification.
Experience with machine learning models highly desired.
Knowledge of statistical and reporting methodologies.
Database knowledge for data management is highly desired.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as, but not limited to: MATLAB, Mathematica, SAS, R, or Statistica -Ability to design programs to analyze complicated scenarios.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Person must demonstrate a high degree of professionalism, enthusiasm and initiative on a daily basis.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment a must.
Attention to detail is critical to the success of this position.
Licensure, Certifications, and Clearances:
UPMC is an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

jobtitle: Lead Health Information Analyst - Fiancial Data and Reporting
job_summary:
Job Summary

The Lead Health Information Data Analyst is responsible for leading the discipline of data analysis and quality reporting as well as the review, assessment, validation and development of data management processes to support Fairview's health initiatives. This role will work in a team environment to lead design, development, and execution of data transformation into actionable information and automated external data submission processes. This role is key to supporting system and network level clinical and financial performance. The Analyst will ensure state-of-the-art quality and population-focused analysis and reporting on quality, risk, utilization, cost and clinical measures through the use of, but not limited to, regulatory specifications, benchmarking, trending, opportunity analysis and predictive modeling.

Leads discussions with care teams and leadership to design analytic reports for quality reporting and population health management using electronic medical record data, claims and other data sources.

Mentors Health Information Data Analysts in the principles and technologies used by the Data Reporting and Analytics organization to support team member proficiency and development.

Accountable for defining requirements, data validation, and supervision of report development to support enterprise analytics, statistics, predictive modeling and external data submissions.

Work directly with the Health Information Report Writers, Data Modelers and/or ETL Developers to create data driven reporting that is meaningful and actionable for the Fairview enterprise, and affiliated networks

Analyzes and models data to provide insight and actionable recommendations.

Partner with data scientists, quality teams and researchers to develop and implement algorithms for performing predictive and prescriptive analytics.

Applies appropriate tests to analytical results to provide high quality and accurate results.

Leads the review process of data sent to external vendors by Fairview. Includes working directly with the external vendors to understand the business rules application to the data extracts.

Researches and reviews benchmarking data for comparison, validation and scope. Identifies areas for greatest opportunity for intervention.

Creates written narrative summaries that outline project purpose, methodology, summary of findings, trends of interest, and opportunities for consideration.

Provides technical, analytical and business guidance to other team members and other departments with Fairview.

Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for improving work; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention.

Job Qualifications:

Required

Bachelor's Degree in a Clinical field, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline required

Master's Degree in a Clinical field, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline preferred

7 to 10 years of experience in analysis of healthcare data and management of healthcare information systems.

Results-oriented, strong collaboration, problem solving and negotiation skills

Handles sensitive and confidential information, regularly exercises discretion and judgment.

Ability to think strategically, analyze issues and develop recommendations.

Database query experience is required.

Strong quantitative and analytic skills.

Ability to think creatively and work collaboratively to address problems.

Ability to write and present reports and presentations.

Are you ready to transform healthcare with us?

For more than 100 years, Fairview has been meeting community needs and achieving breakthrough medical advances in care. We are committed to providing our patients and their families with the very best care and the very best experience. Fairview has seven hospitals and medical centers and more than 90 primary and specialty care clinics throughout the state.

In partnership with the University of Minnesota, Fairview is an academic health system committed to nation-leading research and educating tomorrowÂs physicians and health care professionals. We serve patients from across the state of Minnesota, the upper Midwest and beyond.

True to our values of dignity, integrity, service, compassion and innovation, our employees are improving patient lives and driving a healthier future. Consider being part of our team today.

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to any lawfully protected status.

Knewton is on a mission to personalize learning for the world. Teachers, schools, and education companies use Knewton to power digital course materials that dynamically adapt to each studentâs unique needs. Knewton provides students with tailored recommendations for exactly what to study, teachers with analytics to better support each student, and publishers with content insights to develop more effective digital products.
Knewton has delivered more than 15 billion personalized recommendations to over 10 million students on every continent except Antarctica. Knewton was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in New York City with offices in London and Tokyo. We have also been recognized as a Technology Pioneer at the World Economic Forum in Davos, one of the top 100 Best Places to work by Crainâs New York Business and one of the Fast Companyâs Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Big Data. Investments top $150M from well-known angel investors plus Accel, Bessemer, First Round Capital, Firstmark, Founders Fund, GSV and Atomico.
Our team is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Data Science team. What we need from you:
Passion and enthusiasm for analyzing large data sets and making actionable recommendations
Proven ability to identify relationships within large, not obviously related data sets

Experience with teaching and pedagogy, or an active interest in modeling knowledge, learning, and student engagement Perks Include:
Competitive salary, great benefits, and equity
Great coworkers with a passion for empowering students and educators
Flexible hours, no vacation policy, and paid maternity/paternity leave
High-quality equipment (default: a new Macbook Pro with a giant monitor)
Social groups and sports teams
Free lunch every day in the office, all-day snacks, and a full bar
Free monthly MetroCards/PATH cards
